The suite was very comfortable and spacious for our 4 adults and 2 children.  We had a blast!  The pool was excellent, the beds and pillows very comfortable, and the price was reasonable.  My sister is a clean freak and she was happy with the cleanliness of the rooms.  We are already planning our next stay.

Checked in and my key got demagnetized but they remedied the situation. My room smelled because of someone smoking nearby by they remedied that situation by moving me to another room. I appreciate them making things right and in the end my stay was just fine.

We are a family of four (kids 7 and 4)  and we had to book a double queen bed room.  I don't know why but I was expecting a two room suite.  It was one room and it was very small and cramped.   Luckily, the front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful.  They let us upgrade to the two room suite (KING Suite) which is only one king bed in the bedroom and one NON-SLEEPER sofa in the living room.  No worries, our daughter took the blanket in the closet and one of our four pillows and she was happy on the couch and slept fine there.  Marriott management, it would help your cause a great deal if you change the sofas in the king suite to SLEEPER sofas.  By the way, the King Suite had to be almost three times the space that the two queen bed/ one room "suite" had.   It also had

Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconveniences you have experienced. Each of the issues you mentioned have been addressed with the appropriate department heads.  Our goal is to address your concerns so that we can ensure you have an exceptional experience on your next visit.  We hope to see you again in the future.  Thank you, Hotel Management

Summary: we stayed last  Saturday   ,exellent location our suite was so clean and large  ... nice display,  Bed so comfortable...they have a extra( for me a good touch) make up removed   love this place ....i will came back

My husband & I (AZ res.) were traveling with my daughter & her family (from Ohio) during busy spring break season to the Anaheim Disneyland parks. We found our 2 suite room suites spacious and absolutely spotless. The entire staff, especially the front desk clerk, was very accommodating. The breakfast had a great variety and was always full, even when the room was full and busy. The thoughtful breakfast room attendant even offered us a room across the hall to eat when she saw us scrambling for tables together to accommodate all 8 of us. Thanks to all for making a dream trip even better!!

We stayed here for a week as a family, exploring the amusement parks, beaches, and some city time in Hollywood etc. Location was perfect for us, they offer free shuttles to both Knotts and Disney, plus it is just off of the freeway, but not close enough for any freeway noise. Actually, considering the size of the streets, it seems to be a very quiet area. There are a lot of dining options within walking distance. Depending on what you are looking for, but the dining options are Sizzler, Denny's Fuddruckers, a Korean BBQ joint, a coffee and donut shop etc. There is also a Target a couple of blocks away, so that is also an easy walk. The value for us was really good, as they offered a Military Discount, thank you Marriott! Also included was breakfast, internet, parking, and as

This is a good, clean, affordable place to stay with a quick drive to Disneyland.  There are a few things that seem to be a little run down since we stayed there 3 years ago, but still a great place for the price.  We love staying in the family suite.  The staff is very friendly and nice.

Pros: Clean rooms, plenty  of towels, fridge and coffee maker in room, FREE wifi, comfortable beds, friendly staff, nice pool, close to Target and several restruants. A 20 minute walk to Knotts Berry Farm.  FREE breakfast consisting of: Scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, omelets, sausage, bacon, bagels, toast, muffins, oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, juice, milk, coffee, and FRESH made waffles.  Cons: Rooms were a little noisey. (We could here the baby next door crying at 3AM). The bathroom was very small.

We have stayed 2 times at the Fairfield Inn ans Suites Anaheim norht Buena Park and had a wonderful stay both times. Juan and his helpful staff were just wonderful. Would highly recommend staying at this property. We will be back for sure at our stays in So. Calif. Barbara D.

I recently stayed at the Fairfield Inn and had a great experience.  In particular, the breakfast was excellent mainly because Agatha took such great care of us.  She offered top-notch service and anticipated our every need!

My travel arrangements had changed and I needed to add a night to my stay.  Wesley Lopez at the front desk was very helpful in making that as painless as possible.  The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.

Pros- Room was nice and clean.  Bed and pillows super comfortable.   Cons-Bathroom was very small, with the sink separate from the toilet and shower. Hot water in the shower was was not very hot.  Could hear people comming and going from hallway all night, with doors shutting and closing.  Almost like it echoed through the hallways. Did I say all night???  Yes all night...( insert sad face.)
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim North/Buena Park. We appreciate your feedback and have notified the proper department head. Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel and really enjoyed our visit. Breakfast was included (with veggie sausage for us grass eaters!). The room was clean and well organized, the staff was friendly and helpful, and no problems occurred during our visit. A good value as well, and we plan to return when in the area. Close to Disneyland and very close to Knotts

Summary Heading: Excellent Service by Manager Juan Gomez
Summary: Manager Juan Gomez has performed beyond expectation during our stay at the hotel. He helped us tremendously in finding a suite that fits our needs and comfort in least possible time. His willingness to help and positive attitude towards patrons have made our stay very efficient, convenient and memorable. His expertise is a valuable asset to the company and to your guests. Thank you for the warm welcome. Keep it up.

I‚Äôm a lifetime platinum elite member that finds the entire team at the Fairfield Inn Marriott in Buena Park, CA to be the benchmark in customer service and customer awareness!   I‚Äôm always greeted with an engaging smile and warm welcome.  All of the staff are exemplary but I would have to say that over the years Juan Perez, Front Desk Manager, has gone above and beyond the level of service I have expected.  Although, I don‚Äôt hold him accountable for being a Dodgers Fan though, and our baseball rivalry only strengthens the customer relationship we have.    The food is always fresh and the rooms are very clean. I have never had an issue at this location in the last seven years I have stayed here. I would highly recommend this location to anyone that is looking for a bright respite

I am in a hotel atleast once a week for my job and used to the traditional size of a Fairfield Inn room. I was very impressed with the upgrade/size of my 2 room King Suite. With two bathrooms, a pullout couch, multiple dressers, closets, tons of counter space and a fridge it would be PERFECT for families.  The check in process was smooth, front desk helpful and breakfast hot and delicious. Great Stay!

The $20 extra for a suite was worth it as we were going to be in the room for about 22 hours.  The suite has a bedroom and bathroom separated by a door.  There was a separate TV and bathroom in the living room.  Since my husband and I have different sleep patterns, the separation really helps.  The breakfast area is not organized well.  The poor woman did her best to replenish food, but there was a big bottleneck at the counter with the waffle station .

Summary Heading: first time at this very nice and clean Marriott facility
Summary: This facility is very clean and courteous when you arrive its very conveniently located to Knott's berry farm and the frwy as well plenty of dinning close bye the two bedroom suites are worth the money for extra space and it was very quite in the evening the free breakfast is fair enough for the room they have for the guests one would think Marriott resorts would up selection of items offered but what they offer is good enough to hold you over to find a restaurant to eat the staff is polite and courteous to help with your needs one of there staff here at the facility is  in the air force going to be deployed he is an honorable young man made us feel like we were talking with family when we first arrived and checked in  he was very professional and he will be one of the brave

Rooms kept clean and tidy, and any discomfort reported were taken care immediately. Every staff at Fairfield inn and suites are very friendly and approachable. Maria, Stepheny, Brenden & Juan, keep up your good work. Great hospitality!!!

We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and the Hilton in San Diego for 1 night. We expected the Hilton to far exceed the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park Marriott. Were we wrong! Of course, the view was spectacular at the Hilton, but the Marriott offered so much more! We had free Wi-Fi, free hot breakfast (which was delicious!), very comfortable and clean room, and the hotel staff were friendly, accommodating and welcoming. If you are in this area looking for a solid hotel to stay in, this is the one! Our children had fun in the pool area and our overall experience could not be beat! Thank you Marriott for making our stay so enjoyable! The next time we're in Buena Park, we'll be back! :)

Stayed here with our family for a night. It's super close to Knott's and very short drive. Clean and quite which was perfect for this trip. Would stay there again for an overnight. Breakfast is included and was decent. Kids loved the fresh waffles.

Ok so to be fair, I give them 4 stars because I didn't get a chance to try out the breakfast, so I cant rate that.  We checked in, friendly staff and went up to the room.  The room we had was very nice and spacious, it had 2 bathrooms, 2 beds, and the living area with a couch, which we thought was a sofa sleeper....ooops guess not, but still comfortable although a little short for a person to sleep on.  The hotel and room themselves were very clean and well kept, which for me is always a big plus.  Good internet connection, not spotty or slow at all for those that cant live without it.  Awesome curtains that keep out the sunlight if you are like us that stayed out at the theme park late and overslept the next day.  Will definitely stay again

Summary Heading: I suppose you get what you pay for
Summary: Fairfield is a scaled down Marriott property.  Here's the things I noticed they left out of the deal. No Kleenex in the room. You have to use the toilet paper. The bathroom has no fan, and it is suffocating by the time you are through with the shower. You have to go stand next to the ac unit to cool off. The suite we were in had two tiny rooms and bathrooms were very tiny, like studio rooms. It's clean though. The toilet was very slow. We had a lamp in the bathroom that flickered like the fluorescent lights in the movie "Joe vs the Volcano". Sucking the life out of you. The staff is great. The breakfast was fine.

Summary: Budget hotel, near Knott's Berry Farm.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  The breakfast was good.  We did have a problem in our room, there was a foul smell coming from the tub.  The front desk staff was very responsive.  This is a no frills kind of place.

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel for business and vacation stays. I love it
Summary: Location is perfect - close to Knott's Berry Farm, Disney Land and other local attractions. Breakfast is nice. Close to a ton of restaurants.  I stay at this property almost every alternate week as I travel for business and every single front desk person I've interacted with has been very friendly so far.  Juan is a fantastic manager. He upgraded my room on request a couple of times when I had my family coming with me.   Overall, I would recommend this hotel and I personally would stay here every single time I have to be in this area. I love it

Due to a scheduling error, we were booked into this Fairfield Inn in August rather than September.  When we opened a confirmation email from Marriott, it indicated we should have stayed last night rather than in September.  We were fully charged on our credit card for the night.  When I called and spoke with the front desk, I was told there was nothing they could do and we would be charged.  They did indicate we would get a discount if we booked with them in the future.  We are Marriott Gold Members (50 -75 nights annually) as well as Presidential Members owning several Marriott properties through Marriott Vacation Club.      None of this swayed the gentleman on the phone.  Having worked in Customer Service/Security Guest services at the largest property in Anaheim, I know what

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights whole visiting Disney and Hollywood.   The staff ate wonderful.   Always cheery and helpful.   The rooms were spotless and any problems were dealt with very promptly.  The kitchen staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.   Staff on the reception desk were always willing to help with advice or organising taxis or trips.  We would recommend this hotel to others.

A great base for sales calls.   From the great professional greeting when you walk in, you feel like you are at home.   Rooms were great and comfortable.   Had all the usual amenities you need, workout room, wifi, breakfast, and more.    For breakfast, be aware that it gets busy as this facility is close to some of the attractions.  There were a few places to walk to for dinner, mostly chain restaurants but it make it convenient to not have to drive.   A shopping center close by if needed.
Manager Response: Dear Nida U,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim Buena Park/Disney North.  Each of the issues you mentioned have been addressed with the appropriate department heads. We are not able to store large amounts of luggage due to having limited space available. If luggage was able to be stored, it would need to be 2 - 3 bags maximum for a 1 day period. On behalf of the hotel please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience you have experienced.  You are a valued customer and everything we do is aimed at providing you with an excellent hotel experience.    We would like to regain your trust and hope to serve you again in the future.    Thank you,  Hotel Management

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights, checked in here on the 13th July, although we were booked from 14th here, we took an earlier flight and checked in on 13th. We were 2 families, ours 2 adults and 4 children ages (9-2) and the other 2 adults and 1 child aged (6). They couldn't accommodate us with 2 rooms on the 13th which made us stay all crammed up in one room, which were really congested for even one family. We were going on a road trip on the 18th from LA to San Francisco then to Lake Tahoe, Yosemite and Las Vegas and from there to LA again returning on the 29th for a night stay and leaving for our country Pakistan on the 30th. Upon checking in we spoke to the concierge to keep some of our luggage until we return for the night stay there and they agreed! We shopped a lot as we

My daughter and I were attending a local soccer tournament.  Needed a place to stay that was conveniently located.  Check.  Cleanliness is extremely important.  Check.  We booked a King suite with two bathrooms.  The room was comfortable, clean and welcoming.  My daughter and her teammates enjoyed the pool and Jacuzzi.  I enjoyed the always available refreshing lemon water located in the lobby.  The only downside to our visit was breakfast.  While there were many choices (eggs, cereal, waffles, yogurt, etc), we both have food sensitivities which couldn't be served at this breakfast.  Wasn't a big issue for us but it would be nice to see non-dairy options.

It's a nice place to call it a night. Rooms were comfortable. WiFi worked well too. Breakfast is another story. Lots of starches, no bacon, sausage or ham. I had never eaten powder eggs until my stay here. There's a Denny's down the street, but it's was packed in the morning.

Summary: Nice and clean hotel with an accommodating staff. The hotel was full and the hallway was a little noisy at night. The breakfast area was very busy and the breakfast food was average. We stayed two nights to help our daughter pack her apartment to move.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park. We appreciate your feedback and we will share your message within the organization.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a single night stay
Summary: I gave this an average rating only because I thought above average was over doing it. The only thing "wrong" with this hotel is the elevator was a bit small and noisy, but that was about it. Our room had a large mini fridge and a microwave, comfy beds and plenty of room. Bathroom was a bit smaller than average but adequate. We only stayed one night but would stay again.

Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!

Summary: Hotel rooms large enough.  Sink outside of bath which helps with multiple people getting ready.  Room very CLEAN.  Front desk staff friendly and helpful.  15 min to Disneyland with out all the traffic.  Close to shopping/restaurants.

Mostly we just slept here. Took a suite. We thought there would be two bedrooms but there was a bedroom with two beds and a "sittlng" space separate from the bedroom. There were two baths. The staff was very nice. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate. I would be happy to stay here again. It was about a 15 minute drive from Disneyland and 45 minutes from Universal Studios depending on the traffic.

I read the reviews and was apprehensive about the hotel.  I guess we were lucky because we had a great experience with the hotel.   We reserved 3 rooms: 1 suite with 2 queen beds and 1 king bed, 2 rooms with 2 queen beds. We stayed from 5/13 to 5/16. The rooms and beds were very comfortable.  We were worried about the noise so we brought ear plugs.  I am a light sleeper and yet the noises were not disruptive to my sleep.  One of our rooms was by the elevator so it was noisy until midnight so ask for a room in the corner and away from the elevator.  If I stand by the elevator, I can hear voices from the rooms nearby.  My suite was in the corner and I did not hear noises from the next room so it could be the next rooms were vacant.  I don't know for sure.  The people at the desk

Summary Heading: Good sleep in a smallish room
Summary: I spent a single night in this hotel on a business trip.  The hotel property is nice and the location is convenient.  The room was nice but you couldn't get lost in it.  The sink is outside the bathroom, but the bathroom door completely covers the sink when it is open.   The room had a refrigerator, microwave, and a large flat-screen TV.  The TV channel selection was good.  The bed was comfortable, and the water pressure was good.  The complimentary breakfast was about average for a Fairfield Inn.   My third floor room on the front of the building had a decent amount of diesel noise from passing busses, but it wasn't loud enough to be obnoxious.  Get a room on the back side (even number) if you have a choice.  There was also a loud clunk as nearby room doors closed.  Overall,

Summary Heading: This hotel hits high marks in all areas!
Summary: We stayed as a running group at the Fairfield Inn & Suites and were treated wonderfully well. Location was great - 35 minute drive (late evening) from LAX. 12 minute complimentary shuttle ride to Disney (you need to book in advance), not far off the freeway for easy access. 8 minute walk to Target for extra food needs. Decent affordable restaurants all around although we didn't go to any of them. Very decent breakfast and eating/lobby area. The staff and manager were all beyond helpful and friendly - such a wonderful bunch that never tired of our questions that we asked at all hours! Pool and gym (small) also on site. Free parking.

Summary Heading: About as restful as a homeless encampment
Summary: This property has it all: -Thin walls so you hear every kid in the hotel on both sides of your room at 7am -Intermittent hot water issues -Surly management including Juan the front desk manager who just doesn't care about the guest experience -A lack of respect for the guests and the overall guest experience -No earplugs yet if you search for "noise" on here or on Yelp, you'll find a looooong list of noise complaints.  We asked for them to honor the 100% satisfaction guarantee and remove 1 of the 4 nights from the bill, Juan said we were "compensated" by offering us 2000 then 3000 marriott rewards points (the property itself... or taking $30 off the bill. Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issues. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within the organization.   Sincerely, Management

Summary: Nothing exciting here.  Average. Clean. Decent area.  I wasn't here for Disney so I can't answer anything about that. The hotel was your basic, decent hotel that offered your typical free breakfast.  Room was clean and it was nice to have a mini fridge and microwave in my room.  Smoking area is a bench located at the front entrance so you won't be able to socialize while you puff really.  I was only here briefly but I slept well and I was satisfied.

Summary: The Fairfield Inn was fine, pretty much your average hotel.  Nothing amazing happened for me to write about but I don't really have complaints either.  Check in was smooth and since we arrived at 7pm or so there was no wait.  The guy checking us in was friendly and helpful with our questions of how long he thought it should take us to get to the place my co-worker and I were having training the next day.  The rooms were pretty average, normal size but clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was small and the walls pretty thin, I could hear the people in the rooms around me.  The breakfast each morning was good.  They had lots of choices but some of the items didn't appear to be super fresh.  The location is pretty good, central to most things you would want to do in the area but
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park. We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts from your recent stay. Summary Heading: Great location not too far from DIsney
Summary: Great hotel if you plan a trip to Disneyland. Price is lower than staying right near the park. Nice hotel, rooms look good, nice lobby. Free breakfast and also free shuttle to Disney. Very friendly staff. There a few restaurants close by the hotel.

We chose this hotel because it was close to Disneyland (approximately 13 minutes). I was so presently surprised that they offered mobile check in/out, a gym and an awesome breakfast.  Honestly, the breakfast is what made this hotel spectacular! Agatha, was helping in the breakfast area and she was so attentive and helpful. Whatever anyone needed she was right there to make sure all the guests were taken care of.   We booked a family suite, which consisted of a king room and a separate double queen room. The rooms were very nice and clean, the bathroom was a bit outdated but clean for the most part.   I will definitely be staying at this hotel again in the future and will make sure to refer others to it!

The people were very nice but I had troubles with my hot water and asked for a credit for 1 of the 4 nights I stayed there.   After I had discussions withe front desk manager - he offered me a discount on a future stay.   What a "TOOL".....he does not get it.  I asked a simple questions and Marriott prides it self with customer satisfaction but this guy did not get it.    So word of advice - do not stay here because the Hot water SUX on the 7th floor.   Just saying.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your feedback. I will notify the proper department head regarding the hot water issue.  Thank you and have a great day.  Sincerely, Fairfield Inn & Suites Management

Summary Heading: Typical, Nice Fairfield Inn by Marriott
Summary: This hotel is actually your newer generation Farifield Inn, better color scheme and design choices for the budget traveler in the Marriott family.  It was a good hotel and I would stay again, especially because it is walking distance to Knotts Berry Farm so I didn't have to pay to park!  The only complaint I have is that the breakfast area runs-out fast so having an additional kitchen runner would help.

We stayed here as it was last minute trip to Disneyland and all hotels were booked near. The staff was friendly and the rooms very clean. My husband is platinum elite and we were upgraded to a very nice suite. It was a great surprise for our family. The beds were comfortable. We will most likely stay here from now on as we have season passes to Disney. Only 10 minutes away.

I just checked out and was seriously impressed. The staff overall was wonderful. From checkin to check out every employee greeted me with a smile. The room (2 queen standard) was very clean and ready for an early arrival. I would highly recommend this hotel and am planning on staying again.

Summary Heading: decent hotel, great location, obnoxious kids
Summary: Our room was great, we found the staff very friendly and helpful. Parking is plentiful. The location is very convenient to just about everything attraction wise in the area. Free breakfast was decent, nothing gourmet. There were, as expected, a ton of kids.  Most of them were fine, but the day we checked out there was a sports team or something there.  They had taken over the breakfast area, a few of them were playing games with the elevators and there was a 20 min wait for us to get our luggage down to the lobby (more than once...), and they kept leaving trash and towels on the floor of the elevators. None of that is the hotel's fault, but something to be aware of if you're looking for a quiet hotel or to avoid.

The room next door was soooooooooooo loud around 10pm. Called front desk, she tried calling the, but she stated that they wont answer. I asked to send someone up but she was the only one on duty. ?????? So it went on for another until they finally got somebody to shut them up. Should really hire another person for the night staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your recent experience with us. We have a plan in place to ensure issues as this are minimized. You are a valued guest and we hope to serve you again, when your travels bring you back to Buena Park.   Sincerely, Management

Summary: I travel all across the country and this is my favorite hotel anywhere. It is run by the finest manager in the industry. She always make mine and my colleagues feel like we are staying at a five start resort. All of the staff have been here for years, from the breakfast staff, front desk staff, maintenance staff and cleaning crew. Everyone is always so nice and most know me by name. I always feel at home here. I have never been treated better at any higher priced hotel or resort.

This is a typical Fairfield Inn... and I consider that a good thing. The room is bright and cheery, the bedding is comfortable, and it provides everything you'd expect for a hotel in this class.  I was attending a convention in Anaheim and decided to economize this time. This room if far nicer than what you'd get close to the Anaheim CC, and it's half the price. You lose the convenience of staying right there, but if you planned to rent a car anyway, then it's only about 10 minutes away.

Stayed in a suite with 2 queen beds and 1 king bed,  The suite was actually 2 rooms with 2 bathrooms (there was no door to the corridor for the King bedroom). Paid USD 234.5 including taxes per night with breakfast included. The price was a steal for 2 very huge rooms with individual attached bathroom!  The bed was comfortable for me though my children complained that they were spring mattress beds.  I fell asleep immediately as I was so tired after the universal studio and disneyland trip.  Did not hear any noise though my children again complained that the walls were very thin. They could hear me talking, people talking in the corridor and lift area which was just outside their room.  The only issue I had was the bathroom.  Though the pressure was great and water was hot,

I wasn't impressed with is hotel. It is arranged weird......you have to go out the side door...down the sidewalk to the pool! Rooms are small but clean.....so better get a suitet! I was with a tour group & didn't choose this place.  Probably won't stay here again.

Summary Heading: Shuttle to Knott's Berry Farm runs daily, but only once each way
Summary: We stayed at this property near Knott's Berry Farm because they have a free shuttle to the park which saves paying for parking, but found out when we got there that the shuttle runs only once each day, taking you to the park at 10:00 am, and picking you up at 5:30 pm. If you want to be picked up earlier or later, you have to arrrange that and pay for it. This should be stated on the website. We planned to stay late at the park so this didn't work for us. They did let us leave our car in the parking lot even though we checked out that day. They do not have luggage storage though so we had to leave everything in our car.  The outdoor pool is not heated which was a big disappointment to my kids, but the breakfast was better than other Fairfield Inns I have stayed at. They had bacon

Summary: My family of four stayed here on the first night of our California trip.  We have stayed in many Fairfield Inns but the room we had at this location was very small even through it had 2 queen beds.  The bathroom was tiny.  Breakfast was standard, nothing exceptional.  Front desk staff were friendly and efficient.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park for your California vacation. We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We will share your message appropriately within the organization. You‚Äôre a valued guest and we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Buena Park.  Sincerely, Management

Summary: Consistent with the Marriott chain, the rooms were up to par.  The only issue was the breakfast and the sitting area.  Scrambled eggs are daily with sausage patties, biscuit sauce and bacon alternating.  By the time you get to the 4th day, you would probably be looking for alternatives elsewhere.  When the hotel is full or almost full, be prepared to wait in line for breakfast and sitting.   The hotel is close to Knotts Berry Farm (5 min drive).  Food options are plenty to choose within walking distance.  There is a Target super store close by as well.

I stayed here after a full day at Disneyland with my 8 year old godson.  I had reserved for Sunday 12/27 but would not arrive until late after our time at Disneyland.  I called the day before and Alex the night staff answered.  I informed him I would be checking in very late after the park closed.  He made a note of it. The was scheduled to check out by midday (12 noon).  However, Disneyland had worn me out.  I decided to extend my stay just before checkout.  Maria at front desk made quickly made arrangements.  I did have to change rooms for a few more bucks but it was well worth it.  A better floor and more space.  On both

Summary Heading: Make alternate breakfast plans just in case
Summary: The location was pretty convenient. Very close to Knotts Berry Farm The property was clean and staff was very polite, rooms were comfortable. However, I was disappointed with how the breakfast was staffed. There was only 1 person cleaning and replenishing the whole time. I even paid extra for my son who drove from out of town to join us and all that was available was fruit and yogurt. They ran out of waffle mix and syrup, barely enough scrambled eggs for a serving.  We ended up having to go somewhere else for breakfast so that threw off or schedule. I would imagine hotels close to Disneyland and all the other amusements parks on a Saturday would have better staffing.

Summary: Fantastic multi-lingual staff, even French. Rooms were nice, a tad tight. TV accepted plug-ins. AC was a little loud. Summary Heading: An excellent option to set up your headquarters while you move around Los Angeles
Summary: Our experience at Fairfield Inn Buena Park was pretty good. It is a clean, well maintained and well equipped hotel. We found service also very good, people at the reception was friendly and helpful. It offers a good cost-benefit relation, as well as a centric location to move around LA‚Äôs attractions: Medieval Times show and Knott‚Äôs Berry Farm Park can be reached walking, Disneyland downtown and parks are a couple of miles nearby, the hotel offers daily shuttles to get there. For shopping there are many shopping malls nearby, and Citadel Outlet is about 20 minutes by car. This is a perfect option to

There are nice hotels around Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm, and then there's a very special home-away-from-home called Fairfield Inn by Marriott, where the staff (especially Charmaine at the front desk and reservations--and just about everywhere else she's needed) puts the human touch on the things that matter, like service, cleanliness, room appeal, and great breakfasts. My sister and her husband checked into a 2-room king suite with special mobility access while their house was being updated, and they just didn't want to leave. No doubt about it, Fairfield Inn is a gem!

This hotel is a typical Fairfield Inn. It is close to Disney and Knott's Berry  Farm. There is a shuttle but we did not take it to Disney because there was only one pick up time - before the fireworks and parade. It would have been nice to have a later shuttle pickup time so that we did not have to drive and pay to park. The pool is small and cold. This was disappointing as we all like to spend time in the pool. Kudos to Mercedes in the breakfast area. She kept it immaculate, kept the food filled and even made waffles for people - best service we have ever had at a Fairfield. Don't expect luxury here - it is an average, clean hotel that will do for a visit to this area if you don't want to spend time swimming..

The hotel was very welcoming. The staff was friendly. I was here for work and had to use the "business center' it was easy, no wait and I was on my way. Loved the fact they had a fridge in the room. The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds.  Everything was good except for the guest near by.  I could smell the smoke.  The rooms are suppose to be smoke free but some people just can't follow rules.  I had to place a towel under my door.  I called the front desk and they said they would follow up.  Not sure what that meant.  Other than the annoying neighbor, the stay was good.

This hotel is comfortable inside.  The rooms are just the right size. The location is very close to all the attractions.  They even provide shuttle one a day. The only thing we didn't like about this hotel was the noise.  Construction across the street. Also a bit noisy inside including the a/c unit. If a bit of noise does not bother you than i would recommend it for you.

Summary Heading: They have Shuttle service to Knotts and Disneyland
Summary: Check for the shuttle times because they are limited, but it sounded like they were also flexible.  Nice hotel, plenty of parking, staff was great and helpful.  Breakfast was warm eggs, patty sausage and hot waffles, orange juice, and muffins/dry cereal.

We were a "walk-in" looking at a few different hotels in the area.  We ended up staying in a 2-room suite for one night (9/14/2015).  The hotel lobby was spotless and the front desk staff was very friendly.    The suite was sufficient for our needs, but the air conditioner units were a little noisy.  Also, the beds mattresses are starting to sag from wear, but were overall okay.    The included breakfast was a wide selection including fresh waffles, The woman assisting the hotel guests in the restaurant was friendly.  Again, the restaurant area - like the rest of the hotel - was spotless.  We checked out, but didn't use, the pool facilities due to rain.  While I've never stayed at a Fairfield Inn (I usually stay at full service Marriott's) I was pleased with the accommodations.

Best part of this hotel it is appropriately priced for what it offers. We were going to Knotts  Berry Farm so we only stayed one night, and the park is only 1 mile away.There are many hotels to choose from because of the theme parks near by but will now only  stay here. It is conveniently located off the freeway and many restaurants close by. The room was clean, thought bed was very  comfortable and best of all it was quiet. Left early so didn't have the free breakfast.Hotel also offers free wifi and no parking fees.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay at the Fairfield inn & Suites Buena Park. We appreciate your feedback and we hope to serve you again when your travels bring you back to Buena Park.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: When I opened the door to the room, the smell was so refreshing. It smells like Gain..lol never been in a room that smelled as fresh. Very nice rooms. Clean lobby, floors spotless. Great Work!!! And they are Close to food on both sides of the hotel.

We booked a 2 room suite and were very pleased with our stay.  Party of 4 adults, 1 child and 1 toddler.  Clean, Comfy, very friendly service all around.  Breakfast was good and well taken care of.  The location was so handy for our Disneyland/Knotts Berry Farm centered trip.  Will probably be staying there next time we are visiting Knotts on a vacation!

This Fairfield Inn was clean, and well-serviced, with updated rooms.  The breakfast was decent - the best part was the breakfast attendant who kept things constantly refilled and tidy.  It's about 10 min away from Disneyland by car.

The location is excellent! Right off the freeway close to Knotts and Disneyland. Close to restaurants and target! The hotel itself leaves me wanting! It looks to be renovated but the details are still old. I could on about the dislikes of the hotel but it wasn't anything bad enough not to stay here again, I just won't!

Summary: Our family of four just stayed here- 4 nights in a 2 queen suite. Very clean and comfortable. Pool was great. This is our 4th stay here and won't go anywhere else when in Buena Park. Very close to knotts about a 5 minute drive and Disney about a 10 min drive. Plenty of places to eat nearby as we'll as whatever shopping you need. Highly recommend!!

Summary Heading: Good place to settle between LA and Anaheim
Summary: Basic lobby.  Helpful staff.  Convenient "shop" to pick up a quick microwave meal, snacks, ice cream, drinks, toiletries, etc. is located next to front desk. The rooms were comfortable and they have a nice pool and hot tub outside. We were within walking distance of several places to eat which made our visit even better. The staff was very friendly and our stay was quiet.

We stayed two nights in June. Our stay was fantastic. Lizbeth checked us in and she was beyond friendly. Check in was very quick. Elevators were fast. We stayed on the 4th floor. Our room was a little small but it was okay since we didn't spend much time in it. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The view was nice. Bathroom was very clean and the shower worked great.   Everything in the hotel was clean. The breakfast area was always clean both mornings. She single handedly maintained the entire breakfast room - cleaning, replenishing supplies and making fresh and hot waffles and let guests know when they were ready. I would hire her if I had my own restaurant!

Summary Heading: Great Stay from the Marriott Family
Summary: This is a fine member of the Marriott family of hotels.  We had a two bathroom suite that was very functional.  The second bathroom seemed superfluous at first but the additional privacy and convenience proved to be a real benefit.  The complimentary breakfast on the weekend was a bit limited and disappointing.  The weekday breakfasts were much better with fresh fruit and waffles added to the menu.  The server during the week was cheerful and efficient.  She prepared the waffles and cleaned the tables with quiet dexterity.  The rooms were clean and fully operational.  The location is close to all Buena Park attractions and a short but frustrating drive from Anaheim.  It was quiet and peaceful during the late night hours ‚Äì even with a hotel full of teenage basketball players.

I checked my group 20 rooms on Wednesday May 6 and everything was all set and ready for us. The lobby was nice and quite large for a Fairfield inn. They had two elevators and my group was on the 4th floor. It took less then 10 minutes to get everyone to their rooms. The rooms were good size and the beds were very comfortable. There were minor issues with the rooms but nothing to be concerned about. The staff was there for us answering every question with yes. We wanted to leave early the first morning and they started the breakfast early for us. The breakfast was just ok. Every morning they had a meat and scrambled eggs and fresh fruit and muffins and bagels. As I don't eat eggs it would have been nice to have a waffle maker or two but they didn't have them. They have a huge

Summary Heading: Good location for business on this side of SoCal
Summary: For my meetings it was perfect because my clients where within 10 miles of here so I didn't have to fight L.A. traffic. Restaurants close by, you can walk to a few of them. Liquor store right next door if you want to grab a snack or drink. Staff was very nice and hotel was clean. It was fairly crowded obviously because it is close to DL. Had a couple of issues with people with kids being loud but it didn't last too long. Breakfast lady was on top of things and even making waffles for people. I would stay here again for business.

We arrived at the hotel about 2:30 in the morning. Alex, the front desk clerk, was helping another guest who was being incredibly demanding and handled her situation with patience and respect. When it was our turn, and we found that the type of room we had requested was not available, he was able to put us into a nicer room for the same price. This could be standard procedure but it was greatly appreciated. All the staff we interacted with were friendly and kind. On our last day, Adeline, who handled our check out, was able to help us avert a personal crisis, going far beyond what we would have normally expected. She was helpful, pleasant, and kind. Thank you for offering the kind of experience usually associated with much higher-end hotels. We will recommend your location to

Summary Heading: A Very Pleasant and Comfortable Stay
Summary: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn Buena Park during a recent conference.  The location is great, the hotel is clean and well-maintained, the staff is very helpful, and the amenities are plentiful.  Alex, at the registration desk, and Agueda, the breakfast buffet hostess, were both very pleasant and helpful and made me feel like a personal guest at their own home.  This wasn't my first time staying here, and I look forward to staying here again, whenever I'm in the area.

Stayed at this Fairfield Inn and Suite for the weekend. It is conveniently located, close to Knott's Farm, walking distance to restaurants, small shopping area with Target store, banks and a couple of minutes from the I-5 freeway.  The hotel itself is clean, the staff was nice and friendly. Stayed in the King suite which had tons of space. It had two bathrooms in the suite. The wireless signal was strong and the breakfast, although not great but for a free meal, it was okay. I would recommend staying there. We were pretty happy with our stay.

Juan Gomez, excellent, Adilene, great!, all the employees from the room cleaning staff to the wonderful young lady that worked the breakfast area were outstanding.... She hustled around making sure all the FREE continental breakfast items were ready and stocked.  She even made waffles and offered them to people so they didn't have to figure out how to make them or burn their fingers! :)  We were referred to a real dump across the street and during spring break I was very concerned I would not be able to find decent accomodations last minute.  Juan was very understanding and got us a top floor room that was very clean, informed us that there was a free shuttle to Disneyland and one of the best continental breakfasts I have ever had... I can see why this property (and pretty much

I stayed at this hotel with my family of four because it is about a mile or so from Knotts Berry Farm.  I had booked a room with 2 queen beds.   At check-in I was offered an upgrade to a room with 2 queen beds and 2 bathrooms and with a "living room" space for an extra $40.  I took the offer because I always like to stretch out, especially when travelling with kids.  I was really glad we upgraded.  The room was spacious, and having an extra full bathroom was really handy!  Also, the staff really worked hard to please by consistently reminding me that they are available should I need anything.  Overall, the hotel and room was clean, and the free breakfast was nice and fairly average.  The only downside to this hotel is that the air conditioning unit in our room was really loud!

All of their staff, including front desk, housekeeping, and breakfast service was helpful, efficient and friendly. In particular, Agueda at the breakfast buffet managed the entire service beautifully. She was non-stop keeping the warmers filled with scrambled eggs and sausage; she made sure the coffee pots and milk thermos were never empty; she refilled cups and plates. In between all this, she kept the service area and tabletops wiped spotlessly clean! She is an Energizer bunny with a smile!

We stayed in a 2 bedroom "suite," which was basically 2 standard bedrooms connected by a door, with one door to the hall.  The room with the King bed had a generous bathroom counter, a table and chair. The second room with 2 queens had no chair and a very small sink area, but it had a microwave and compact refrigerator. Breakfast included scrambled eggs and a meat (sausage, turkey Canadian bacon), 4 cold cereals, yoghurt, fruit, muffins, bagels, toast and waffles.  The waffles were very good.  The breakfast area was well serviced. Hotel staff were friendly and professional. We stayed 4 nights in March 2015.  There is construction across the street, which was a natural alarm clock around 7am, mostly due to the beeping of trucks in reverse. Close to several restaurants & stores

Summary: Adi at the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay more comfortable.  After our room's A/C had a problem, she sent Ana from the maintenance team to try and correct the problem.  Ana was so pleasant and tried her best to fix the unit.  Unfortunately, the unit needed some a replacement part, but Ana reported it to Adi at the front desk who immediately searched the hotel for another room with a working A/C.  Not only did Adi find a room within 5 minutes; she had Ana come back to help us move our belongings and bumped us up to a suite for our inconvenience.    Both ladies were helpful, friendly, and efficient.  Thank you!!

Summary Heading: great location and very accomodating staff
Summary: I have stayed in Fairfield Inn's and other Marriott properties in all 50 states and in 5 countries and I have never stayed in a room as spacious and comfortable as I did when I stayed in room 101 at the Fairfield Inn & Suites in Buena Park, Ca. There is plenty of room to work and there are 2 t.v.'s and 2 full bathrooms. The hotel staff is so accommodating that they even exceed your needs. There are restaurants within walking distance and a pool on-site and tourist attractions are just a short drive away.

Over the course of 5 years, I have stayed here multiple times. Each time, the staff was very friendly, especially Charmaine and Jeckster and the rooms were very clean. In addition, the rates are exceptionally good.

We were very pleased with the rooms  and service we received while staying for 2 nights in mid February.  Adilene  as well as the others at the desk were available whenever we had questions and took care of all of our needs quickly and efficiently.  The breakfasts were delicious and had a nice selection of choices.  We have already recommended this hotel to other family members and would gladly stay there again if we are in the area sometime in the future

We stayed here in February for three nights to visit Disneyland.  The hotel is about a ten to fifteen minute walk to the gates of Disneyland.  The staff at the hotel were great and very helpful.  The room was very comfortable and very  clean.  We had a room overlooking the pool and a good view of the fireworks at Disney.  The are a lots of options for dining close to the hotel. We would stay here again.

The hotel was taken over by Marriott in 2011 and refurbished.  The breakfast was excellent and the rooms were clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly.  The outdoor pool is not heated and small.  The hot tub was not working.  There is construction going on across the street and the banging started at 7am.  Apparently, a new hotel is being constructed.  We were close to Annaheim and Disney.  The hotel runs a once-a-day shuttle to and from Disney and Knottsberry Farm.  We stayed at a Military Rate of $110 plus tax a night.

While the room was clean and the staff was friendly, this property was average at best. We are Marriott Platinum members so we were upgraded to a "suite" but it was 2 boring rooms with a connecting door on e first floor overlooking the parking lot.  The bathrooms were very small, they were experiencing plumbing issues so our water was turned off from 11-2 both days we were there. Not very convenient to say the least. The toilet in the bedroom bubbled up 5 times overnight, which was a bit disturbing. Hopefully the maintenance resolves that issue. The mattress was very hard, the decor was decent and the complimentarty breakfast was standard, nothing out of the ordinary. It's locaction is convenient to Knotts Berry Farm as well as Downtown Burbank but that mall is gross, I don't
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim Buena Park/Disney North. We're pleased that you found our staff to be friendly and the room clean. While it was a pleasure having you here as our guest, your feedback caught my attention.  Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the proper department heads.   Thank you!

Summary: We are loyal Silver Marriott members.  We stayed 2 nights over the Presidents' Day weekend. Hotel is very close to knotts berry farm which we visited and staff was friendly and room and property were very  clean.  Overall we had a great stay but had a few issues - we went to the pool/ spa four times while there and each time - no towels. Had to tell front desk each time- can't you just put a pile of them Out there and check every so often? Next-our AC was blowing hot air- but called the front desk before we left for the day and was fixed when we returned. Those minor things won't keep from returning!  If you want a nice hotel with big family size rooms- you can't go wrong with this Fairfield.

Summary Heading: A stress free hotel. Highly recommended!
Summary: We stayed here almost 3 years ago and decided to stay here when we visit LA again last February and as always we love our room, the hotel maintains its cleanliness. Mr. Jecsther Dela Cruz is very helpful, he knows how to give an excellent customer service. Thank you for making our stay very comfortable and satisfying. It's our favorite hotel! Good location, good service,affordable price, perfect room! Couldn't ask for more!

The hotel is nice, but don't plan on staying here to go to Disneyland - the shuttle only goes two times a day- and it's after the park opens, and well before the park closes.  It's also not on the ART route - so plan on spending $$$$$$ on Uber or taxis.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete our Guest Satisfaction Survey and sharing your experience with the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim Buena Park/Disney North.  Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconveniences you have experienced. Each of the issues you mentioned in the survey have been addressed with the appropriate department heads.  Our goal is to address your concerns so that we can ensure you have an exceptional experience on your next visit.  You are a valued customer and everything we do is aimed at providing you with an excellent hotel experience.    We would like to regain your trust and hope to serve you again in the future.   If I may be of assistance, please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact me.    Thank you,  John Arredondo Director of Sales Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park

Summary Heading: They will take care of you!
Summary: I LOVE these people.  I got in at 12am and they had a room waiting for me with not problems.  They took care of my car as I forgot to put the form in it, either way, the next day the desk gave very good directions and ideas on what to eat that was Local.  Either way I love the service at every form, and I can't wait to get back there.  As some people say, ask for the upgrade, and that works about 85% of the time.

I travel to LA on business frequently and call the Fairfield Inn & Suites my home away from home. I receive a fair price and excellent service from the staff and though I am on a first name basis with many of the staff, I am always treated with respect and kindness. Adilene is one of the best!  I couldn't recommend a better place to stay.

Great place to stay. The rooms are comfortable and very nice. I didn't want to get up out of the bed in the morning it was so comfortable. Located near all the attractions. Great staff very helpful! Charmaine and Janet at the front desk are the best.

Summary Heading: Great Service at fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park
Summary: I travel a minimum of 85 nights per year and the Fairfield Inn & Suites ranks at the top. They service my room upon request when I return early. They upgrade me to a larger room when I have a second person at no extra cost. They treat me like the frequent traveler that I am with dignity and respect. I couldn't recommend a place to stay more when you are in the So Cal area.

Our family stayed for 8 nights. Welcoming staff - always a friendly "hello" whenever we passed by. Free parking. Free shuttle to knotts & disneyland. Shuttle driver (Lupe) was very friendly & accommodating.  Breakfast varied from day to day (hot & cold options). Hardest working breakfast attendant I've ever seen. Thanks Ageuda! Certainly clean & well kept hotel. Unheated outdoor pool but managed to swim in it one day. Thanks to everyone at the Fairfield for a great vacation stay.

Summary Heading: Great place for business or personal travel
Summary: The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Check in was easy and the rooms are nice size and comfortable. Adilene was at the woman at the front desk. When I asked questions she was right on top of answering and on spot with recommendations.

I've stayed at this hotel many times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are comfortable and the entire staff is friendly and courteous. Further, I would like to compliment Agatha, who is in charge of setting up the breakfast buffet She is helpful and attentive and makes sure that the tables are clean at all times. By the way, the food is outstanding, in quality and variety--better than you find in most other hotels. I should also mention that Juan, at the front desk, is a true professional, always willing to accommodate our needs throughout our stay. Whether for a night or a week, I highly recommend this centrally located hotel, which I am happy to give the highest rating.

Summary Heading: Excellent Value for Visit to Knott's Berry Farm or Disneyland
Summary: A well managed and maintained Marriott property, this is a very good lodging value for those visiting Disneyland or Knott's Berry Farm.  Both parks are just a few miles from the hotel.  Shopping and restaurant facilities are nearby.  Significantly, the hotel operates free shuttle services to both Disneyland and Knott's saving guests the expense and time of the paid lots.  For questions, call the property directly at 714.670.7200.

Thank you very much for your hospitality. Everything was wonderful. Hotel was extremely clean. Juan makes you feel like your at home and part of his family, and adilene was very personable. Thanks guys appreciate you very much.   Wayne & Cynthia  (Salinas)

I am enjoying this stay very much. Even though I'm in and out mostly because of work the staff here is so friendly. Adilene and Amanda (they put up with me the most) have been so sweet and everyone is so polite always greeting me no matter what. Thank you and I appreciate the continuous great service!!!! Keep it up :)

Whether a family or a tour bus - this hotel is very acommodating and helpful.  Rooms are clean and spacious.  Breakfast is delicious and a great variety for all tastes.  We had biscuits and gravy one morning and scrambled eggs and canadian bacon the second.  I heartily recommend this hotel and their amazing staff under the capable management of John Arredondo and Juan Gomez.

We stayed at this facility in 2013, and found it to totally meet our needs.  We selected it because my wife has stayed there on prior occasions, and it continually offers a nice room at good value.  For our stay in January 2015, we needed to make an adjustment to our reservation, and Juan went above and beyond to accommodate our request.  We live in Northern California, and have several friends and relatives in Southern California, and we find this location to be perfect our needs, with easy access.  Thanks to Juan and staff for everything.  It was an awesome display of customer service!

I love this place!  The staff is so friendly and helpful.  They really care about their guests. The hotel common areas and rooms are very well maintained.  A very good hot breakfast is served daily.  G.A. from La Quinta

My family and I (equaling 6) went on an spontaneous trip.I stayed at the Radisson Hotel and well my mom always taught me " if I don't have anything nice to say don't say anything" so we decided to look for another hotel and found the  Fairfield hotel. It was 101% times better... From rooms to people in general. I would highly recommend this hotel....

Summary Heading: Like A Cooler Room to Sleep?  Don't Stay Here!
Summary: The location of this hotel is freeway close and not far at all from Knott's Berry Farm.  BUT they control the temp of the room at night!  It was so stuffy and hot it was horrible!  I called down to desk and they told me it's monitored at night!  This would have been a BIG NO WAY if I had known about it.  We were getting up early and going and so it was just horrible to have no sleep!  This is a definite no go for me and the people we had in two rooms that the same problems!!!!
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park/Disney North.  Our room thermostats can be controled at all times by our guest without any restrictions. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to serve you again when your travels bring you back to Buena Park.   Sincerely, Management

Summary: Our family stayed two nights in a family suite.  For the price, we found it to meet all of our expectations.  The two bedroom setup was totally adequate, if not huge.  This was one of the smaller suites we've stayed in, there is no living room area or couch.  Essentially, it is two connected rooms.  There were two bathrooms, which was convenient for a family of six, but they were on the small side,  the property is about a ten minute drive from the Disney parks, which could be taken as an advantage or disadvantage depending on your preference.  Not the nicest part of town, but not a bad part of town either.  Room was quiet, clean, in good condition, modern and comfortable.  The shower had good pressure.  The beds were on the firm side, but acceptable.  We didn't have a lot of

This Fairfield Inn is amazing!  Completely remodeled and exceptionally clean!  Located off of the freeway in an excellent location.  The breakfast was ready before the time stated and had a good variety of food.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.  I was very pleased with my stay and the staff was very friendly at check in and check out.

Arrived at around 9:00 p.m. - woman who checked me didn't say much at the time.  Handed me my little card with the room key.  I got upstairs into the room only to discover the parking pass was also in the card packet and the pass needed to be on the dashboard.  Maybe you could have mentioned it when I was checking in????  Breakfast was okay but the woman managing the dining area was awesome.  Very friendly and offered to make waffles for people who wanted one.  Only there for two days....will try another Marriott next time.  Had a room with two queen size beds which were decent but bathroom was very small.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to give us your feedback during your recent stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park. While it was a pleasure having you here as our guest, your feedback has been share with the team. We hope to see you in the future whenever your travels bring you back to Buena Park.     Thank you.

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Fairfield, Adilene and Amanda took care of all of our needs. What a pleasant suprise they were so courteous and pleasant. Thanks. The room was really big and had two queens. The lady that serviced the buffet was one of the hardest workers that7 I have seen. She deserves a raise.

This hotel, located in a tourist destination spot, was surprisingly well managed and run.  The clientele was unusual, a mix of business people, foreign visitors and families.  Each of the groups has a divergent set of needs.  In spite of this fact, I think the hotel staff did an excellent job of keeping everyone happy.  Room was clean and all things functioned properly in the room, which what you would expect in a room, but don't always get.  What I thought was most pleasant was breakfast service.  There really wasn't anything special about what was served, but the breakfast attendant did an excellent job of keeping the breakfast area clean and the food stocked.  Marriott's typically have waffle makers which seem to be problematic especially for foreign travelers, unfamiliar

We checked into this Fairfield Inn & Suites for the first time.  We picked it for a combination of reasons: location to Disneyland, location to where family lived, price, free parking and breakfast.  We feel we made the right choice.  The location is just a block away from the 91 freeway on and off ramps.  The place is very clean and spacious.  The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful.  Two days after we checked in, my mother in law wanted to drive down to visit with us and stay at this place.  I made a reservation for her with Fergi, who got us the same rate, but wasn't able to get her on the same floor as us because it was full.   When my mother in law checked in, I accompanied her and Adilene helped us out.  She was able to find us a room on the same floor which made

After a long 5hr drive ,i was completely exhausted.but when I arrived to the hotel I was greeted by Adilene and she made my experience feel like I was right at home! The check in process lasted  less then 3 minutes and she Aldo answered all NY questions without me asking ! I would defitenly return to this location next time I'm around orange county.

I stayed with my family,  I was greeted by Adilene. Room was clean, we stayed on the 7th floor and had a great view towards mountain.  We could see the some mountains covered with snow. Nice place to stay.

My dad and I recently stayed at this property for about 5 days. Everything went completely smoothly. They checked us in a little early, which was helpful. There was a trainee practicing and she was even great on what must have been her first week.   The real best thing about this hotel was the room. My dad and I travel for business and we don't mind having the same room if we have space. Well our room was huge! One room with 2 queens in it, then a heavy door leads into the king room. 2 bathrooms too!   The layout of the room saved us a TON of text messaging and running back and forth to each others rooms to work!  Awesome stay!

Very close to freeway access and shopping.  Does not have an on-site restaurant but they do serve a decent breakfast buffet and there is a Sizzler next door if you don't want to drive any further for lunch or dinner. Disneyland and Knottsberry Farm are close and there is a complimentary shuttle from the hotel that will take you to Disneyland if you like but you must make arrangements the day before with the front desk.  Rooms are very nice sized and quiet for the most part.  The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Our view was the front of the hotel and it really wasn't much of  a view as there is new construction across the street, however, we weren't there for a 'view' so it was just fine.  The beds are comfortable and there are plenty of pillows. Very clean hotel

Summary Heading: Good hotel, great staff, nice location to Disney.
Summary: The hotel was in a good location for being off the Disney property (10 minutes), yet it is one of the only in the area to have a shuttle bus if you would like to not pay for parking.  The staff (cleaning, breakfast, and front desk) were all very cheerful and wanting to make our stay the best it could be.  They placed a candle in a blueberry muffin so our daughter could celebrate for birthday.  The little things made our stay wonderful.  The rooms were standard hotel rooms that have seen some wear and tear (our tub leaked water all the time and could not be shutoff), some dust in places if you really looked, but overall it was clean, friendly, and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast was done well and the staff also kept it well stocked even when busy.  Management seemed

Made to feel very welcome the moment we arrived. We were quite a few hours before the permitted check in time, but when they realised we had checked out from a 'disappointing' venue, they were more than happy to accommodate us, so that we could relax and enjoy our holiday. We were looked after by the Manager Evelyn Wheeler and John (Director of Sales? not sure only glanced at his name tag). We had booked a Queen Suite (1x K + 2 x Q) and the room was comfortable. An interesting set-up was the bathroom sink being in the bedroom, not the bathroom. Didn't bother us. The children enjoyed the fact that they didn't have to share a bed. The breakfast was basic but staff were constantly at hand to make sure tables were cleaned and food re-filled. Staff were pleasant and helpful. We have

I came with my son and his family for a vacation to Disneyland.  The hotel rooms were clean (we had adjoining rooms with a door), they were very small and the vanity was in the bedroom not the bathroom.  The beds were comfortable.  The people were friendly and very nice.  The breakfast selection was wonderful on the weekdays!! (however the selection was changed and limited on the weekend).  I especially wanted to comment on Agatha-she was the young person who did the breakfasts during the weekdays.  What a trouper she was making sure everything was refilled, tidy and that if you needed help she was there to help.  She was the only person working the breakfast bar at times and she did not stop a minute.  I was very impressed with her kindness and work ethics.  The kids enjoyed
Manager Response: Good Afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim Buena Park/Disney North. Please rest assured that your experience has been shared with the team in an effort to improve our services.   Thank you.

Summary: Felt very welcome and were attended to in an excellent manner by all employees.  The ones that really stood out were Adilene, Agetha, and Ligette.  The morning breakfast was made better by the constant service, preparation, and cleanliness.  The location of the hotel was very convenient to all the attractions in the area

Summary Heading: Super nice & clean, plus a great staff
Summary: Spent 3 nights, was on the 7th floor.  Nice, clean hotel with very friendly staff.  Modern decor with interesting color patterns.   It was really hot outside (100+ most days) and the hallways were very hot.  The air conditioner in my room wouldn't cool below 80F and at times didn't work at all.  There was a problem because it was running again after the power was shut down for a minute or two, but it took a couple hours to get to that point. Breakfast (included, starts at 6:30 am) had lots of choices; waffles, eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, cereal, yogurt, breads & pastries.  Lots of non-English speaking (and somewhat rude) tour groups gathering in the lobby (and at breakfast) in the mornings so timing for leaving or eating may be hectic at times.  Tour buses were parked in

this has to be one of the best place's to stay not only for its location but on how friendly and helpful the staff are that work there, couldn't of ask for a nicer holiday thanks to there constant need to make you feel welcomed. would recommend that you think about this hotel before you book elsewhere.

My wife, daughter and I had a really fantastic stay at this hotel. The whole staff was professional. At the front desk, Juan helped us a lot as he went above and beyond the call of duty. He directed us to the best Mexican restaurant as we wanted to eat authentic Mexican food. He also arranged for us the LA tour bus and advised on how to go about the visit at Disneyland as my daughter was celebrating her sixth birthday. Great job guys, keep it up.

We arrived in LA at 7AM in the morning and went to the hotel to check-in only to be surprised by their extremely late check in time, however, the staff figured it out a way to store our luggage and get us on a tour that same day. Juan at the front desk was very knowledgeable of the area we were in. Housekeeping, Mercedes, made sure that everything was clean and when we didn't need service, they where sure to ask if we did. The breakfast was pretty good for being free. I would say that our overall experience with this hotel was great.

the stay at this hotel was very good .At the front desk adilene was there she was very helpful to us  she gave us whatever information we wanted .we felt that we were at home .we advice all marriott hotels to have adilene at all hotels the way she was helping not only us but lot of people on the front desk and i coul;d see lot of people were comf to ask here what they wanted to know about the near areas

We chose this hotel due to the location to Knotts Berry Farm. We had a two room suite as travelling with older children. Rooms were fine - clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were on the small side and would agree that the A/C was rather loud. Breakfast buffet was OK, nothing special but probably as we expected.  Good to have free parking and free WiFi and the location was great for the nearby theme parks as well as several restaurants and shopping. All staff we encountered on reception were very friendly and helpful.

We enjoyed our stay for the weekend. Good location, plenty of parking and close to walk to restaurants. Very clean hotel and rooms are updated, spacious, clean, comfortable. A/C was loud but worked well. Staff very friendly and plenty of luggage carts. We picked this hotel because it had a hot breakfast buffet, we were not disappointed. There was plenty of types of food to choose from. I would stay at this hotel again.

I thought my family& I booked a nice hotel until I started to see bugs on the beds!!!!! I reported to management& they moved us to another level; but then we spent the next 2 days doing laundry while on our vacation! And they only refunded 50%. I'm sorry but if you wanted to ensure your customers were going to come back and were happy with how you dealt with the situation. ...you wouldn't refund just 50%. You would refund 100%. I will never ever stay here again!

Summary Heading: Very good place to stay but loud a/c in the room
Summary: All great, but a/c units in the rooms are very loud so can't sleep with them on and can't open the windows. We were in room 710, so maybe the other rooms are'nt so loud. Other than that, great place to stay with clean rooms, comfy bed, large room fridge, great front desk service, great bfast and close to everything. Worth staying here and driving to disneyland rather than staying close to disney and paying the premium price. Really liked it.

Summary Heading: A good clean place to stay!
Summary: Caesar at the front desk was friendly and very helpful.  His warm, friendly smile made us feel like he was welcoming us to his home, not a hotel!  Our room was clean and roomy. Very inviting! Adilen's, also front desk,  recommendation of A'roma, a superb Italian restaurant, nearby, was perfect!  Delicious Italian food!  We will definitely revisit both on our next trip to the LA area.

Summary Heading: Adeline a the front counter is great!
Summary: Adeline at the front desk was very helpful, very polite and very friendly, with a great sense of humor.  She is a very nice person to meet at the end of long drive.  Were I in the service industry, I would hire her in a heartbeat.  George in Room #505. August 17, 2014

I booked this hotel based on reviews on multiple travel websites including trip advisor ;) and i was not wrong. Its pretty close to Disneyland- approx 10 mins drive and also to Knottsberry. The rooms were clean and spacious. Bathrooms were a bit small. we booked a 2 queen bed room. free parking was a plus. The hotel breakfast was nice too. Overall the hotel was very well maintained. Good for families and everyone alike.

This hotel was very convenient for my husband and I when we needed an affordable, clean hotel to stay for one night while visiting family. we had plans to go to a nearby local attraction and this hotel is quite convenient to several locations. The room was clean and had a refrigerator and microwave in the room. The complimentary breakfast was mediocre, but at least there was yogurt and fruit. The bathroom was somewhat small, but it was remodeled (2011, I think) and clean. The only downside for us was that we were placed next to the elevators, which made it impossible to sleep in with the noise. I would stay here again, very affordable.

My family and I stayed here on our recent vacation in California. First of all the Hotel is right on a really busy road, and a shady neighborhood. They are building a mall or something across the street so that is your view. Our window was crusted full of dirt and bird poop, really gross. The room was so tiny it was a joke. The bathroom was no bigger than a portable toilet, seriously. It consists of a tiny dirty shower, and a toilet the sink is outside the room. You can't even change your clothes without smacking your arms on things. The two double beds were crammed into the small space that there was really no room left in the room. The beds were so terrible hard and uncomfortable that by 5 in the morning our backs were killing us. Housekeeping was a nightmare! we would spend
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback about your recent stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience. We take great pride in ensuring our guests' satisfaction. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We have addressed your concerns with the appropriate department managers. We hope to serve you better during your future visits to our hotel.   Thank you.  Sincerely,

Summary: We had booked to stay 7 nights but extended it 9 once we had been there a few days. Really nice place to stay, nice staff, good location for access to attractions etc.  Plenty of car parking. Extremely good breakfast buffet, ladies who run it make sure that nothing runs out and the tables are cleaned promptly.  Would stay there again.  P.S.  It's not obvious form the web site but they do have a self service laundry with 2 washing machine and 2 tumble dryers.   All priced very reasonably.

This hotel was exactly what I needed, plus more! The room was lovely, even if the bathroom was a bit small.  I didn't expect a frig or a microwave, but there was one and that came in super handy! The desk staff was always friendly, asking how my day was when I returned in the afternoon/evening, wishing me good morning when I came down for breakfast.  Breakfast was great- the first morning, I didn't even have to make my own waffle! The staff was trying to make sure the waffles rolled out efficiently (it was busy!), so they were making them for us! One thing that didn't bother me, but might bother others- you can hear the fireworks from Disneyland, loudly.  I was surprised, but I could also see some of them from my room, so that was a bonus!  I would definitely stay again.

Stayed here a few days, I really liked the breakfast in the morning, we had waffles and eggs. Very helpful when you have two kids.  The room was nice and staff was helpful and accommodating.  Could not rate it Excellent because when we turned on the air conditioner, it smelled a little musty. Nice swimming pool for the kids; Overall, a positive experience.

We booked this room as we were attending a wedding in the area and just needed a place to crash instead of driving the hour and a half drive home late at night.  Upon check in, we were greeted by the friendly staff! As we are Marriott Rewards Silver members, we were upgraded to a suite automatically!  The room was great! large, spacious, clean,and had very colorful, fun decor!  I loved that we had TWO bathrooms! always a plus! the breakfast was meh.  Every staff member we came across greeted us, and were very friendly! Would DEFINITELY stay here again!

This Fairfield Inn was very good as they always are. Clean room, clean halls, helpful staff. Being summer, the place was a bit congested with families and kids, but that is ok.  My only problem with this one is the lack of low carb options at breakfast. Instead of sausages, they offered sausage gravy along with a long line of cheap high carb choices. The only protein available for an Atkins dieter like me was the scrambled eggs. For $144 for the night, it seems there should be more than one food to eat.  I'd stay there again, but plan to pack in my own food for breakfast.
