I really enjoyed staying here.  Nice sized rooms, well appointed.  Good gym I went there twice. It is very close to everything.  The staff is very nice and very helpful.  There are plenty of restaurants near by as well as a Target and other shopping.  This is a very nice property and I will stay here again.  If you were going to Knotts Berry Farm or Disney it is very close and very family friendly. The breakfast bar is packed and fresh.  The ladies working the bar were nice and friendly and helpful.   There is also a little shop with some snacks and beverages.

Summary Heading: Nice stay at this Marriott near Disneyland
Summary: My family stayed in a two room suite with one king and two queens.  Overall the stay was nice with no major issues. Disneyland is about a 10 minute drive whereas Universal Studios is more like an hour or more depending on traffic. The room wasn't what I usually think of as a two bedroom suite as there is no living room area.  It essentially was two adjoining rooms but with only one door leading out. Hot breakfast is available but certainly nothing to get excited about. I felt that the 9am shutdown time for breakfast was a little early. However,  there is a Denny's walking distance away. The staff was very helpful and was able to get us on an impromptu LA city tour minutes after checking in, which I really appreciated.  The only minor irritation was with the thermostat that was

Placed in a good location to access all Anaheim attractions, adequate breakfast although it does get busy in the mornings. Great value no frills hotel the hotel grounds, common areas and rooms are clean and tidy, the check-in staff are helpful and it's great that the hotel has free parking which appears to be unusual in the area.

I booked a 2 bedroom suite. As soon as we got in to the room, it was dark and dull. There was no couch or table to eat with. These 2 bedroom suite was actually a 2 connecting rooms. They call this suite? No couch. no table to eat, not even a single chair! All we got is beds lining up. The other room has a small tiny computer table on the wall so we pulled that out off the wall and use it to eat. Folks, I kid you not, this is not a suite. It's 2 rooms connecting to each other. I'm a Marriott fan but this is far the worst. I stayed in several Fairfield inn many times in the past and it was not like this. Not even close. Oh..breakfast is like the one you get from 7-11 thing. I give 2 stars for the front desk guy who was very friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give your feedback during your stay with us at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park. I want to apologize for any inconvenienced you experienced and for the room not being to your satisfaction. We hope to regain your trust and serve you better on any future stay with us.  Thank you and have a good day. Management

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for all things Anaheim and Buena Park!
Summary: This is a good home base for the attractions of Buena Park and Anaheim. Breakfast had a good variety. Easy freeway access and there are eateries and stores within walking distance. It was a good choice for our trip to Knott's and Downtown Disney.

We stayed at the Fairfield Inn this past weekend for our granddaughters' softball tournament in Cerritos.  The location was perfect and it only took us about 15 minutes to get to the fields.  We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  It looks like it's been recently remodeled and the d√©cor is beautiful!  Everything was VERY clean, including the carpeting in the hallways and in the room.  We got a two-room king suite on the 7th floor and it was very spacious with 2 bathrooms and flat screen TVs in both rooms.  The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was fresh, clean and updated.  The lobby had a nice area that all the families hung out in after the games were over on Saturday night.  We were able to have food delivered and watch TV and visit.  The hotel is within walking

The staff was genuine and very professional. When thee customer ahead of me has extensive questions and there was a deep language barrier the young lady at the desk very politely told them she would help them out after she quickly checked me in. Both I and the other guest were happy with the service.  The air conditioning was the best ever in a hotel. I am a hot sleeper and they let you control the ac to just the level you want versus throttling it at a high temperature.  I will totally go back for the value the room the service and the microwave and refrigerator.

Summary Heading: CLEAN ROOMS, has TRANSPORT VAN to DISNEY, Good Deal, Good Stay
Summary: CLEAN SPACIOUS ROOMS, GOOD SVC FROM FRONT DESK, HOUSEKEEPING, BREAKFAST STAFF, LOVED THE FREE TRANSPORT TO DISNEYLAND, FREE CONTINENTAL HOT BREAKFAST. GOOD STAY OVERALL. Got the Suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths which was nice to have separate bedroom for us and another for the kids.  Rooms were spacious, separate TV. Bathrooms were clean, housekeeping was prompt and good, front desk was friendly helpful proficient and prompt. Breakfast staff were proficient in restocking when ran out of things (had 2 high school music bands roll through during our stay) a little noisy and crowded at breakfast time and during our hotel stay but staff were great. Breakfast was the usual fare of scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage yogurts fruits(bananas apples), muffins toast English muffin bagels

Summary Heading: The included breakfast was OK, the coffee was not
Summary: My only criticism was that we could not open a window in our room for fresh air which made our room very stuffy. The only ventilation was the air conditioner in the wall that sounded like a 747 taking off when it was running. The included breakfast was OK, the coffee was not. As expected, the room was clean as were the linens and the bed was comfortable‚Ä¶.. I think Marriott has the best beds in the hotel industry!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park. I want to apologize for ant inconvenience you had during your stay. I have also addressed all your concerns with the proper department heads.  Thank you for choosing Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park.  Sincerey,  Management Team

Summary Heading: Good lodging, nice ammenities, good value
Summary: Spent a few days while on a business trip in the area. This is a newer facility and the room furnishings are more modern and pleasant than other locations.  Booked a King suite, 1 bedroom, two bathrooms, comfortable bed and pleasant living area with fridge and microwave. This is a spatious suite compared to other similar hotels.  The hotel is nice and clean, curteous staff, coffee and tea in the lobby. Weather was a bit iffy and did not use the outside pool. The area is not the best but has some restaurants and stores in close proximity such as Target and others. There are some construction sites ongoing right accross the street but will be much better when they are done. Easy access to the highway.  This is a great hotel for families, maybe a bit less for business people. There
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Rasvan,  Thank you for your feedback. It is our intention to score 5 from every guest. We are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We look forward to serving you better during your future visits.  Thank you.  Sincerely,  Management Team.

Summary: The hotel staff was very friendly, the rooms were beautiful and VERY clean, and the morning breakfast was to die for! something different to eat every day, and it was all fantastic! ONLY real complaints: 1. you have to walk outside around the building to get to the pool.  2. for some reason the light to the bathroom was OUTSIDE the bathroom on the main wall... family kept accidentally turning it off while someone was in there. :) and 3. the shuttle to Disney was nice but not really convenient. The shuttle only dropped off at 8:30am and 9:30am and it only picked up at like 6:00pm and 10:00pm, which was frustrating because Disneyland didn't even close till midnight.

we had a 2 bedroom suite and it was awesome! Comfortable and just great. The hotel was clean and pleasant with good temperature control. Breakfast was a little chaotic as there was a large party of teenagers on our first day - but we still managed to eat! For dinner I'd recommend fuddrukkers just 2 minutes walk if you've never experienced something like that! Only disappointment is that I'm a Marriott member but as our agent booked it as we were staying in multiple locations, I don't appear to have gained my usual points.

I stayed for a couple of days last month and I had an absolutely nice stay ! Housekeeping is great. Dexter and Dani were very welcoming. Free shuttle to disneyland came handy.  I will definitely come back. Breakfast is good too! 11 out of 10!!!!

We stayed here for one night during a "quick" trip to Disney.  The hotel is actually much closer to Knott's Berry Farm, but only about 10 minutes from Disney.  The rooms were good, but the bathroom was perhaps the smallest that we have had at a Fairfield....not a problem, just different.  And, I do stay at Fairfield Inn's often.  We arrived in the afternoon, and the front desk staff helped us find a restaurant that was great...  We would recommend this hotel as an option for Knotts, and an alternative, less expensive option than many around Disney.

Summary Heading: Consistent Quality, Good Location, Lots of Tour Buses
Summary: I like staying at Fairfield Inns because the quality is fairly consistent.  You get a comfortable bed, a big desk for your computer, fridge, coffee in room, a free breakfast, and free wifi.  The staff at this hotel was very helpful and courteous, and the location is excellent, being just down the road from Knotts Berry Farm, and close to all the other amusement park attractions.  The only reason I would shy away from staying here again was the amount of tour buses that use this hotel.  I was here for an overnight work stay on a Wed night, and Thurs morning there was a huge busload of people checking out, and a very long line for breakfast. I stayed an extra three nights for vacation, and there was another bus checking out on Sunday, and on Saturday night there was a huge amount
Manager Response: Dear Michael F,  Thank you for your feeedback. I do apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay. We have addressed your concerns with the appropriate department heads. We do not host tour groups on a consistent basis. If and when we do we will have a seperate breakfast area for them. We do appreciate your loyalty to Fairfield Inn & Suites and look forward to serving you better on your next visit.  Sincerely,  Management Team

Summary Heading: All you need for an overnight to Knott's
Summary: My family and a few nieces needed a place to stay before a day at the park.  We needed two rooms, and I asked for adjoining.  We got that.  The rooms were clean, comfortable, furniture and stuff modern and updated.  Fridge, microwave, television, all that stuff great.  Great shower, parking right out front for free.  Staff was very nice.  Food in morning was standard.  We eat Kosher, so we could only eat some of the food.  But for a free breakfast, all you would want.  Although I think 9:30 is a bit early on a Sunday to take the food away (but I asked for a bowl of cereal after closing and I got it).  There's a pool we never used, so can't comment.  Also, they gave us a free shuttle to and from the park (but only if you want to leave at 10:00 to go there and 5:30 to go back.

We stayed here for 5 nights in November while visiting Disneyland.  We stayed in the room that has one king bed, a living room and two bathrooms.  At first this configuration seemed a bit odd, but it was wonderful.  Both bathrooms have a separate vanity area, which made it so everyone could be getting ready at the same time.  The hotel was very clean and we didn't have any noise from the construction or the road, however we were on the side of the hotel opposite from such potential noises.  There was a fridge and microwave in the room and both worked properly. The breakfast had lots of choices and they changed the hot items for each day of our stay, which meant we didn't get bored of the same old thing.  However, there were a couple of times that the hot items were out and the

Summary Heading: Good location, friendly staff, met all expectations!
Summary: My husband, father and I stayed here from Saturday through Monday while we were in the LA area for a Kings game and Ducks game.  It was a great location (about 7 miles from Honda Center, and 21 miles from Staples Center).  We had the "family suite" which is a 2-bedroom suite with a king bed in one room, and 2 queens in the other.  There were 2 restrooms, a microwave and fridge.  Having a complimentary breakfast was nice, but the food was blahhh (besides the waffles) but what do you expect when its "free".  There was an Asian tour group staying while we were there (they took up 60 rooms) so as long as you avoid the "breakfast rush" before they head out, you'll be fine.  The bed was a little firm, but still comfortable with decent, clean sheets.  I also appreciated the fact they

My family and I stayed here for three nights while visiting Disneyland over our Christmas vacation.  Our check-in was seamless and to our wonderful surprise we had been upgraded to a suite.  I had spoken to Juan earlier that week and expressed some concern about not having a sofa bed.  Juan was very courteous and said he would try to help us, which he did.  Thanks again Juan, we are Marriott Rewards members and have stayed in many Marriott hotels and you are the first to go out of your way to help.    The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The morning breakfast had a nice selection and I took advantage of the free shuttle to the parks.  All in all an excellent place to stay!

Terrible Management and Customer Service Checked in very early called ahead and was told they would charge a day rate $25 - $50  day rate charge. That was fine with me got to hotel and was told something different. Then the front desk person who I spoke to and wrote down her name denied she said that. I admit I was quite crazed when I called to confirm this but luckily my husband was in the car with me and confirmed that is what she said. Ok so that was the first issue. Then when I emailed the manager who was suppose to contact me the day after and failed too. I mentioned the loud construction going on outside. He was happy to help at first and offered an upgrade for my troubles. However when we moved rooms we were moved to another loud room. It was one issue after another with

My family and I stayed at this hotel the first week of December to visit the local theme parks for the Holiday Season. Our room was a double queen bed room on the third floor near the elevator. Our room was very clean and perfect for our needs. They also serve a decent breakfast buffet every morning so you can fuel up before a long day at the theme parks. The hotel is in a very convenient location just minutes from Knotts and Disneyland. It is also surrounded by various places to eat and there are various stores in close proximity as well. The floors can get a bit noisy at times, but that is to be expected because of all the families who are there with their children just as I was. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good value and convenient to shopping and restaurants.
Summary: The hotel offers complimentary shuttle buses to and from Disneyland. The hotel staff were very helpful in assisting us make tour enquiries and bookings.  There are a few restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel. The only downside is the hotel location if you need to use public transport to get around as it is not near any train stations.  Hotel is recommended if you can work out how to get to and from the hotel if you are using public transport.

My family and I stayed at this location at the end of September for three nights. We were very pleased with our accommodations! Our room was practically spotless, two comfortable queen beds, a huge fridge, microwave, free wifi and parking!!! There was a lot of construction going on during our stay but we didn't hear a sound. Very quiet hotel with really friendly front desk staff. They even provide fruit infused water in the lobby. Will definitely stay here again during our many future Orange County getaways.

We just got back from Disneyland and stayed at this hotel. Only 10 , minute drive to the park. Room was very clean. Breakfast was perfect. Staff was very attentive. Nice lobby area to socialize or use the computer. Definitely would come back here.

Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite!  Woo Hoo.  There were four of us traveling and the added room (two bedrooms) was such a wonderful gesture!  Two  bathrooms too.  The breakfast is really good and plenty of room to eat.  The hotel is located in a perfect place if you plan on going to Knotts Berry Farm and not too far from Huntington Beach.  Lots of fast food and right off the freeway (I-5 and CA-91)   I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and I always  have a good experience.  The elevators are a little slow.

Everything about this hotel was great from the front desk to all the service personal. Juan on the front desk was very helpful and a great asset to the hotel. The girls that were taking care of the breakfast went out of their way to make everyone special. There is no doubt that we will be back.

Stayed in a king/2 queen suite and the property is great with adequate parking. Comfortable beds, good breakfast, and quiet location. The elevators were slow and noisy when riding, but you didn't hear the elevators once you were in the rooms. Since it is right off the freeways (I-5 and CA-91), it is very conveniently located close to Disneyland. Didn't like that the in room fridge didn't have a freezer section so I couldn't freeze my ice pack, but that is a minor detail.

We Stayed at this Hotel on September 22, 2013, we had a suite.  It was a very nice one at that, TWO bathrooms, so was awesome to not have to wait your turn for Shower priviledges.  The staff was very nice and, and helpful, they gave us several suggestions for restaurants in the area, The bed and room temperature was very comfortable and, we had a nice view from our room.  It is very close to Knotts Berry Farm and, the Titanic artifacts and Bodies Exhibition, (that is awesome by the way, a review is also on Tripadvisor). The front desk even had discount tickets for us. The breakfast was nice with waffles, sausage and, eggs, there was a variety of other items as well.  Overall very pleased! Would stay again

My adult daughter and I shared a suite at this hotel for three nights.  The room appeared to be recently renovated, and it was spacious and clean.  All front desk staff members with whom I talked were friendly and helpful, although at times the information I received differed from one person to another.   What seemed odd to me was this:  There was a separate bedroom and living room area, two tv's and two bathrooms - all a plus.  However, the sofa in the living room was not a sleep sofa.  My daughter and I had not planned on sharing one bed.  The situation was remedied by calling for a rollaway bed, which was brought to the suite promptly.      On the two mornings when we attended the breakfast buffet, all items were available and fresh, and the space was not crowded.

Summary Heading: Close to Knotts Berry Farm park
Summary: This hotel was close to the high way and Knotts Berry Farm. Very nice hotel, very modern up to date decor.  Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was big and beds were very nice and cozy. What I liked about the room was that the sink was outside of the bathroom. So if you have a family mean while the bathroom or shower was in use, you could have the sink to use outside of the room. The free breakfast was very good and lots to chose from. The only thing that I did not like was to get to the pool and whirlpool. You had to walk outside of the hotel to get too. However in order to get into the pool area you had to use your room key.

We stayed here for 10 nights while our kids were in a Residence Inn nearby. The Fairfield turned out to be the cheaper but better hotel. The location is not very attractive but there are several restaurants in walking distance and it is not far from Knotts Berry Farm. The whole hotel was recently renovated and is now in very good shape. Rooms are a bit larger than in most Fairfields, have excellent bedding, refrigerator and microwave. Receptionists and maids are all outstanding. Enough self parking not only in front but also in back of the hotel. Breakfast was always crowded during our stay (they open a second room when it is too cramped).

My Son was enrolling at Biola University. This hotel is very close . We chose this property for several reasons. Proximity to Biola, Refrigerators and microwaves in the rooms and free breakfast. We stayed 3 nights. The Hotel was nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. The beds very comfy. The sink is outside of the bathroom. so you do hear those at the sink either early or in the middle of the night. The downside was that the pool closed at 10pm, seems pretty early for Summer time. We went to the pool around 10 am the next day. The water was freezing and the Jacuzzi was cold. This was very disappointing. The breakfast was fine for free (I have had better), The serving and eating area were very crowded. It is close to Knott's Berry Farm and good eating.

We stayed at this Fairfield because the location was centrally located between Anaheim where we were going to Disneyland and baseball games and Los Angeles.  Make no mistake, the drive into and out of Los Angeles was horrendous and I don't believe there would be a good place to stay to make that trek.  We were pleasantly surprised to find they ran a free shuttle to and from Disneyland so that saved us about $25 on parking.  The rooms were clean and the breakfast was better than most, eggs, bacon, waffles, pancakes, each day they changed it up a little.  I would stay here again if we went back.

My husband and I stay here occasionally for business.  We are consistently happy with the clean rooms and the service provided.  The breakfast provided is an added bonus.  Juan is great, he always does his best to make our stay comfortable.

Stayed two nights here based on proximity to Disneyland.  Hotel was clean and modern. The bedrooom was a normal size, however the bathrood was very small. The breakfast was fair.  There are a number of restaraunts located near the hotel which is only 7 miles from Disney.  Would recommend.

Stayed here 7 nights last week.  Beds were comfortable.  Rooms were quiet and cold if you wanted it that way.  Breakfast was good.  Recommend the bigger room with a sofa if more than 2 in a room. Very clean and everyone was very nice and helpful.  Would definitely stay there again. Also target and restaurants very close. We used their pack in play crib.  It was great with a much softer mattress than normal.

Summary Heading: Would be above average with some improvements.
Summary: My family stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for our annual Disneyland vacation.  We were there for five nights, Friday through Wednesday and we were in a two queen bed room.  There were four of us so it was perfect to have two queen beds BUT there wasn't enough drawer/wardrobe space for all of our stuff.  The whole time we were there it seemed like we just had stuff sitting around cause there was no place to put it.  The elevators were crazy slow, which made it frustrating while doing the breakfast thing.  Breakfast was complete chaos - I went down at a different time every day and each time there was a long line for the food.  There was no where to sit at all and the room was an absolute MESS.  They really need to do something about the configuration for breakfast - put the

I've been staying here for work its been a pleasant experience. Its got new furnishings, the staff is attentive, and the beds are awesome. I don't know the area very well but its located right off some major highways which made it easy to go west to the beach or north into LA.

I've been staying at this hotel every week for the last one month, as I work in the area. Rooms are obviously very clean as this is Marriott. Room service is A+. Staff is very friendly. Specially Danny and Cesar. They always smile and welcome you. They help you in every which way possible.  Managers Frank & John are perfect gentlemen. I will stay at this hotel as long as I work in this area.

Summary Heading: Nice room but breakfast room was a Zoo!
Summary: Spent one night at this hotel because it was walking distance to my sister's house.  Room must have been recently renovated, very nice.  When checking in, it was obvious that the clerk gave me the standard response ("we are fully booked") to my inquiry regarding upgrade since she did not even bother to check the computer.  I know that there are availabilities since I had checked their website that morning.  No big deal as we were there for only one night. Breakfast at 8:30 AM on a Sunday morning was a zoo, a line of at least 15 or more people, no vacant tables.....So-called turkey canadian bacon was not edible..Best to eat early, that is, if you all you want is a bagel, coffee and yogurt.  parking is free.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Fairfield Inn & Suites
Summary: We stayed for five nights at this hotel. The service of the staff is fantastic. They were happy to help any time we asked and were very friendly. We took a family suite, 2 bedrooms, and the beds were comfortable.  There was a shuttle service to Disneyland which was free and we had 2 options in the morning for pick up and 2 in the evening for return. The lady who runs this service was Lupe and she was very friendly. The breakfast was ok, pretty basic, but it was free! There were eggs, waffles, toast, cereal, coffee, tea, yogurt, fruit etc. There were a few people at breakfast but we always went early, we noticed it did get busy around 8.30am. Some people also took breakfast to their rooms. We also used the laundry which was really handy, the change was easy to get at reception. I

Surprisingly quiet considering location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rates are pretty darned good. In Korean neighborhood so good international food right nearby, easy access to highways this was a good hotel.

Good value for your money. Lots of extra's for the family. Around the corner from Knott's Berry Farm, close by to Disneyland.  Staff is super friendly and really seems to appreciate your business.  Suite are nice, renovated and roomy, 2 bathrooms. Really surprising that the sofa does not pull out into a bed. A pull out sofa would make this hotel even more family friendly. Roll a way beds are very springy/lumpy, Ok for kids.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay but food service could use improving
Summary: My family stayed here for the first time after a visit to Knott's Berry Farm. The location was great and the price fair. The room was very clean and the beds/pillows were comfortable. It was also very quiet. I didn't care for the decor (orange & green) but that wouldn't keep me from staying here again. What I didn't care for was the breakfast. The space where breakfast is served is way too small for the number of people the hotel has to accommodate. The servers were constantly removing the serving bowls/trays to refill them (they were small as well), which left a lot of people standing around waiting and crowding the already small space. The coffee service is placed at the front of the buffet line which only adds to the congestion. Those trying to get food had to stand and wait

Went to Los Angeles for my son's USC graduation. Stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim Buena Park for Marriott points and in order to stay at the same place my son and his family were staying, who were also going to Disneyland during the trip. Nice location with good restaurants close and freeway access right around the corner. Smaller outdoor pool (it was too cold when we were there to swim). Very friendly and helpful staff who after the first night moved us to a different room once we discovered a large gap under the door that let too much light and noise into the room. My wife wanted to just go buy some weather stripping and fix it ourselves but we brought it to the staff's attention and they took care of us right away. Very comfy beds and for a person who usually

Super friendly staff, Target and restaurants close by (try the korean bbq & sushi next door).  The online room descriptions are a little confusing.  Call the front desk directly, our favorite room is the 1 king/2 queen 2ba family suite for $200.  Easy drive to Disney and back as well as the science museum.

My husband just returned from a great vacation. While in California we stayed at the Fairfield in Buena Park.  We picked it because we had Marriott points and it was centrally located to what we wanted to do. We were not disappointed. Upon arrival, Vincent upgraded our room to a suite for our anniversary. It was a lovely room that was big, clean, and comfortable. The pool and hot tub area was nice. The free breakfast was also enjoyable with many items to choose from. We cannot say enough about the staff. Vincent, Juan, and Lauren were all very helpful and personable. In particular, Juan was very sympathetic with our credit card fraud situation in Culver City. They helped to make our trip very enjoyable.

This hotel isn't half bad. The good things: nice helpful staff. The day we arrived we wanted to get into the thick of it, so we arranged a night tour around Beverly Hills and Hollywood as soon as we checked in, which the staff managed to arrange - expensive, but more than made up for by our guide, David Ford. If you get him to do a tour of LA with you, you won't regret it - as long as you talk to him back! The hotel itself was nice, rooms weren't basic, yet not like The Mirage suites! It was just a good standard hotel with the facilities you need.  We stayed here for a trip to LA (Santa Monica, Hollywood etc.) for a couple of days. I don't think the realisation of LA traffic had hit me, or how long it'd take to get into the main 'tourist' areas of LA itself. This is the only

We have stayed many nights at this hotel in the past 2+ years. It has become a home away from home. Friendly staff greet you as you come and go; rooms are clean, well stocked and have coffee pots, irons, & blow dryers. Ice and laundry room easily accessible to the guests. Internet available in the lobby. Full breakfast every morning. Be sure to say hello to Agatha at breakfast. Her smiling face greets you during the week. Juan, at the front desk, is exceptionally helpful and professional. He goes out of his way to assist when you need something. Top notch accommodations.

So the family decided to do a short road trip down to Disneyland on a weekend which has been many years. We had a great time and planned on driving back after leaving Disneyland but we decided to stop by a hotel near the park since we were so tired and the drive was a bit long.  We found a great rate at this hotel so decided to give them a try.   I was very impressed at check-in, it was late and the front desk gentleman was very friendly and made us feel welcome. Since this was unplanned we didnt have all our toiletries but the front desk person gave us everything we needed since they have extras there.  In the morning I was surprised breakfast was included. Everybody there was really friendly too and made us feel like we were at a fancy breakfast place. I wasnt here for too

I had a bad experience at this hotel and wrote a Trip Advisor review about it in March 2012. I needed to return to the area for another sporting event. The Courtyard was booked so I decided to try this hotel again, hoping for improved customer care. I received an email of confirmation. Then, the day before my stay, I received an early morning phone call from a manager saying that I was "prohibited" from staying at their hotel. He had read my reviews and believed that I needed to find another hotel. I guess freedom of expression has no place at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim/Buena Park. Be warned, if you complain about a noisy stay and bad customer service, you may be "prohibited" from returning. And your reservation may be cancelled, leaving you without any accommodations.

Everything was as fine except i noticed it was pretty loud with music and people running around above us. The room is nice and we were all ready to go for a swim to wind down after a long  drive and were surprised to find out the pool wasn't heated. Too cold so we skipped. The breakfast was just right for us. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Reminded me of my college dorm room
Summary: My family took a trip down south from San Jose.  Because our trip took awhile to get there, (I have 2 small kids), it required a late check in.  We checked in at about 1030pm, and I was surprised to see a mass of people inside the lobby.  There are a LOT of kids here, most likely because of the location this hotel is to Knott's Berry Farm.  Anyway, we checked in and got to our room.  Very disappointed to find out that once we lugged both kids up and our heavy luggage, our keys didn't work.  Very frustrating that late at night.  So I sent my husband down while I carried my youngest in my arms passed out asleep.  We finally made it into our room and it was very small, but very clean.  We had the 2 queen room.  I felt very cramped and I was disgusted to see our bath towels neatly

Location is great if you are planning a trip to Knott's Berry Farm. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Good facilities including free WiFi, small pool & jacuzzi. Large clean rooms. Only real downside is breakfast, but I guess if you want a basic American breakfast, then it's passable. Can be noisey, given the location, expect lots of children!!

Summary Heading: One of the better places in Buena Park
Summary: This freshly renovated hotel offers convenience, clean and fresh rooms at reasonable price. Close to freeway but far enough from noise, close to tourist destination and restaurants  this place is certainly better choice then near by Holiday Inn

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but hallway noise is bad
Summary: My son and I stayed here during a mini-vacation at Disneyland. It is about 10 minutes from the park. The hotel doesn't charge for parking the way the hotels closer to the park do and the prices are better.  The room was very nice. Breakfast buffet was standard fare and was kept well stocked by attentive staff. Internet was free and worked well.  My only complaint was noise from the hallway. The gap under the door was large enough to place our morning paper under the door which means we heard EVERYTHING that went on in the hall. There were families with very young children who didn't seem to think keeping them from screaming while in the hall was necessary. It made it hard to fall asleep.  Some weather stripping around the doors would probably solve this problem and would be

This hotel is recently remodeled.  It used to be a Hampton Inn and Suites the last time I stayed here.  The room was clean.  The bathroom was small, just room for the bathtub and toilet, but certainly usable.  The free breakfast buffet was your standard eggs, cook your own waffle, muffins, toast, etc.  Nothing fancy but edible.  It's a little farther from the freeway than the nearby Holiday Inn and therefore quieter.  The staff was pleasant and helpful. There is a Sizzler and Fudrucker's next door and a shopping center in walking distance with a Black Angus and Golden Nights restaurants and Target.

Before I go on my rant, I would stay here again and would not discourage anyone from staying here.  Room was small, a little crammed and the beds were a little hard.  Overall, the staff was nice, the hotel was clean.  I had to contact guest services twice and they immediately attempted to resolve the issues.  The internet was down the night I needed it, but was up and going the following day.  The breakfast was okay, could have been better.  The kitchen area is very small and we had to wait several minutes for more eggs and biscuits, but the kitchen staff appeared to be doing everything possible to keep up with the demand.  I stayed here when it was the Hampton Inn and there wasn't much of a change.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel and terrific staff members
Summary: My family and I went to Disney for our family vacation.  We stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Anaheim Buena Park/Disney North hotel.  We had a wonderful time.  The hotel was clean, centrally located to restaurants, Disney, amusement park and other activities.    It's close to target, fudruckers, sizzlers, 24 hours subway, pollo oco, aisian/sushi buffet, walmart, KFC, Medieval Times, Knotts Berry & lots more stuff.  Our room was always in immuculate condition and well stocked with toiletries and linen. Check in & check out was a breeze. The front desk staff and breakfast staff were very professional, attentive and concerned with our needs and making sure we enjoyed our stay. We loved the variety of hot and cold breakfast choices.  The front desk staff were wonderful in

Stayed for three nights recently at this hotel as part of a trip to Disneyland. I have stayed at a number of Fairfields all over the country and this one had some pros and some cons. Overall, I would stay there again.  On the plus side, it's very close to Disney. It took us 7-8 minutes to drive to the park. While they don't offer a gourmet breakfast, it's better than other Fairfield breakfasts I have experienced because they did offer two hot food items each morning....eggs, bacon, etc. Most other Fairfields I have been to have only offered carbs, carbs, carbs. Our King room was small but adequate. Very clean. Also, 20 minute drive to the John Wayne Airport (SNA).   On the down side, it wasn't in the most swanky neighborhood. We walked to Fuddruckers (down the road) one night

Summary Heading: No frills, but a decent option
Summary: If you're looking to save a few dollars and avoid the hotels directly surrounding Disneyland, this is a decent value. The staff is great, but the hotel is very simple and the walls could use a little better soundproofing. Free WiFi worked great, which is a huge plus. The biggest problem is the breakfast, which is free. Unfortunately, it's not free of problems. On the day we were there, it was so crowded, there was a long line down a narrow walkway just to get to the breakfast bar.   The breakfast selection isn't great, which is fine since our expectations weren't that high. But the seating area was tight, and it really wasn't worth the trouble. Ideally the hotel will remodel the breakfast area in the near future and perhaps create a buffet-style setup in the middle of the room

First, easy to find.  Right off of the freeway, and you're there.  Parking-plenty of it, and no charge.  And only 10 minutes to Disneyland; 5 minutes to Knott's; and 30 minutes to downtown LA.  The staff were all very friendly, professional and didn't take forever to process my reservation.  It's close to EVERYTHING.  Across the street is a Target and a Denny's.  Many other facilities within a short drive.  I was going down for a wedding in Anaheim, and this fit the bill.  Very clean and quiet.    Had the morning breakfast where there was more than enough food.  For the price, it can't be beaten.  Overall, a great value.    Was there a downside?  Sure.  It's location to Disneyland.  If you're going there, then you're aces.  Otherwise, expect to have kids yelling and running up
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive feedback! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: This hotel is a nice hotel to bring families, located close to Knotts Berry Farm.  The staff was pretty helpful with directions and printing out maps for me.  The breakfast was good, would have liked a little more sitting area though.  The refridgerator and coffee maker was nice to have in the room especially when traveling with kids.  The only bad thing was the walls are a little thin, the people next to us were very noisy so we had to put the tv on to drown out the sounds a little.  A great location, had a lot of places nearby to eat and visit.

This hotel looks new.  It is clean, the rooms are roomy, the beds are comfy and have ‚Äúsheet on sheet‚Äù (no nasty spread or comforter).  There is a fridge, microwave and coffee pot in the room.  Breakfast was included with eggs, waffles, muffins, biscuits & gravy, cereal, fruit and more.  The breakfast area was clean and the food was fresh and well stocked.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  We got a call from the front desk five minutes after we got to the room to check if everything was to our satisfaction.  It is a 5-minute car ride to Knotts Berry Farm.  Unfortunately, there is nothing but chain restaurants nearby for dinner.  We were very pleased with this Fairfield Inn and would certainly return.

We stayed at this hotel on our vacation for 10 nights The hotel was very clean, well maintained. The staff was very friendly We had a suite which was nice for when we brought our grand child over to visit. The bed was very firm but comfortable enough. Breakfast was typical for a hotel buffett Now on to my issues with this hotel Wifi  worked poorly First two days no problem after that could not connect or connected poorly Staff did try and fix issues but never were able to resolve. I just gave up on complaining  . Upon checking out we were told that most suites have this issue because they were in the corners except for one room If I had been told this I would have requested that room  (wifi was very crucial in our desision for hotel as my husband owns his own business)

We stayed four nights recently and got to know this hotel well.  You can tell from the elevators that the property is older but it's been nicely remodeled and is up to typical Fairfield standards.  The rooms are smaller but efficient in layout, they have a nice work desk and small sitting chair.  The heater/AC is good with a constant fan option.  TV is a nice flat screen with some channels for kids and the typical cable selection.  Excellent wifi signal and quality but kind of annoying how often you have to accept the terms and conditions.  Fridge and Micro are helpful.  Showers and the bathroom are typical of Fairfield, everything worked well.  Beds were clean and comfortable but left my back hurting from the hardness.   The morning breakfast is great but can get very busy.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disney Land, CA
Summary: We stayed here for 3 days, with family while we were there for Disneyland. Though it appears to be a business hotel, we pretty much felt f=comfortable for leisure stay. Clean , well lit rooms and exceptional staff.  Spacious / well designed / nice carpeted rooms with Fridge and Microwave helped us to take care of the kid's needs. They provide shuttle  for Disney land which is very good. The location of the hotel is convenient , just off from I5 and it's close to restaurants (24hrs Subway next door), Target, gas stations, etc and since we're here for Disneyland, it's a good distance of a drive as well. Free breakfast is good as well.

We used points to stay for free for 6 nights. Pros: Free large selection breakfast, hot tub, close to restaurants and Knotts Berry, nice beds, clean rooms, free parking, friendly staff. Cons: Pool is not heated (freezing) no in room safes which is very annoying locking your things up with the Hotel staff daily.

We stayed here because we had some Marriott rewards to use and we got more nights for our points here than any other Marriott affiliated hotels in the area.  Because of that, we were expecting a lower grade hotel and services.  However, the fact that tripadvisor had this hotel rated #6 out of 18 in its market area gave us some comfort in booking in the first place.  We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the facility, the friendly staff, and the overall cleanliness of the hotel.  Things I liked best were the staff, in particular, Nick, the night auditor.  He remembered my name from the first day and went out of his way to accomodate our every need.  The breakfast crew and housekeeping staff were hardworking and outstanding at their jobs.  About the only dislike was the

It is so clean and welcoming. We stayed here at the end of last week and decided To comeback here a few days later . The beds are so Comfortable! The daily complementary breakfast had the best selection! Fresh waffles, cereal of all kinds, sausages, scrambled and boiled eggs, toast, biscuit, eng muffins, bran/blueberry/banana muffins, lots of fruits, all sorts of beverages, coffee/tea, oatmeal, gravy, grits etc! Best complementary breakfast ever! They also had complementary water near the Elevators! Every single staff member there were friendly, happy and so helpful.  Free parking! They even have a free direct shuttle to Disneyland. We opted not to use it cuZ the last shuttle comes back at 8pm. We ended u driving to Disneyland n Parked there $15/day. It is 5mins away. Also we

We stayed for 4 nights for our trip to Disneyland.  The ladies who helped with the buffet breakfast in the morning were outstanding, and went above and beyond to accomodate guests.   The housekeeping staff was also awesome.  We always came back to an immaculate room, and the first day the housekeeper even arranged our toiletries that were scattered all over the sink area neatly on to a towel for safer keeping!  Our room also had a good sized refrigerator and microwave, which was really convenient for reheating snacks for our kids.  My only complaint would be about the temperature of the pool....my 2 year old and 4 year old REALLY wanted to go swimming, but the water was just too cold for them to go in.  Other than that, absolutely no complaints.  We will definitely be staying

Summary Heading: Good value for size of room closeness to highways
Summary: The rooms are spacious and clean. The check-in is speedy. The staff is quite helpful and friendly (I've been there twice and plan to go again). The breakfast is adequate to good - typical hotel fare. Beds are firm enough to be comfy without being boards. Water pressure is average. Bathrooms are clean. Accessibility to highways is simple and close. There's a lot of places to eat nearby, and although the neighborhood has some transient elements, it seems safe and I've never had a problem there with walking around after dark or parking. Whenever I stay in the area, I choose this hotel.

Summary Heading: Not so good, Not bad either
Summary: I was here on business for a week and it is a average hotel. I did not see the marriott vibe here and it looked more like any other hotel. The break fast is not great and it is always crowded. It could be a little more spacious. The customer service is good, I arrived in early and they got me an early check in. I had forgotten my travel accessories like the toothbrush and paste, I requested one from the front desk. It is of very cheap quality, the bristles get tangled between the teeth. Dont use this one if you happen to.

Now, i usually take bad reviews on here.. with a grain of salt.. but ... This hotel was horrible.. i ave it two stars because our room was clean.. and they had nice new comforters and comfortable beds..   we checked in for two nites with another couple and they did give us ajoining rooms. and the rooms we clean and new curtains and new bedspreads but that was about it..  the fridge in our room didn't work..  they had no closet, but they had a wardrobe in an odd place..   The major complaint was the NOISE!~!! omg  the people in the hallways all hours of the nite.. you could hear EVERYTHING!! and then again at 5am... the doors had no sound barrier at all!!!  A car alarm went off in the middle of the nite for almost 45 minutes There are police driving through the parking lot every
Manager Response: The pool area is not located near a dumpster. This guest is most likely mistaking the pool equipment area which is fenced off next to the pool as a dumping area. I hope they did not throw any trash there!  Our hotel offers complimentary breakfast buffet with a different meat option each morning. In addition we offer scrambled eggs, home potatoes, english muffins, yogurt, cereal, hard boiled eggs, pastries, muffins, waffles, & granola. I'm very sorry to hear you went to McDonald's! We offer adjoing rooms based upon availability and were able to honor this guest's request for such. The guest even stated the rooms were clean and comfortable but only grades us one star above their overall satisfaction.  As far as the noise is concerned, we share a parking lot with the Holiday Inn and do our best to monitor the lot. The Buena Park Police are kind enough to assist us with this and we are appreciative of that. We also monitor the hallways via security cameras from the front desk. Unfortunately these cameras do not offer sound, any internal noise complaint would need to be reported to the front desk in order for us to follow-up.  Our business center is top notch, unfortunately since they are shared computers it will not access some companies secured sites to conduct business. Other than that, our guests frequent the center and are able to print boarding passes, theme park tickets, & check personal e-mail, worry free. As the newest hotel in Buena Park, we understand expectations are a bit higher for us and we strive to meet those expectations. We're very sorry this particular guest did not enjoy their stay with us and hope they give us another try when they visit the area again!

Summary: We stayed for one night for a trip to Disneyland. This hotel is about 10-15 minutes from Disneyland. Our room was one of the big 2 room suites. One room had a king bed and the other 2 queen beds. The hallways were extremely muggy. You would leave your AC room and start sweating as soon as you hit the hallway.  Problem - When we arrived, both customer service agents were helping other customers. After about 4-5 minutes, one agent opened up, but he proceeded to do other paperwork and tasks. My "excuse me"s fell on deaf ears. After another 3-5 minutes, he said "oh, do you want to check in?" Really? I am just standing at the counter with my husband and three kids with our suitcases for fun??  Problem - Breakfast is awful. For less money, we have gotten much better breakfasts at

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious, quiet, hotel. Great customer service!
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at this hotel. The room was very clean and spacious and there were a lot of spaces for parking. We stayed for 5 nights in the 2 bedroom suite, Room 224. One bedroom has 1 king bed and full bathroom while the other bedroom has 2 queen beds and a full bathroom. There was a flat screen TV in each room as well as separate controls for the air conditioning. In the king room there was a huge counter space that we put our regular sized coffee pot along with food items on.  In the queen room, there was a microwave, mini frig, vanity, and desk. Housekeeping kept the rooms spotless and well stocked with towels, sample shampoo, cream rinse, and hand cream. I must say the room was very spacious and the beds were comfortable! It was quiet as it is

The hotel was good but not great. Staff was friendly most of time. I had expected more for the rate I paid, especially the breakfast. The hot breakfast consisted of the infamous watery Army T-Ration eggs and cold potatoes. The room was clean; I had to have toilet 'supposedly' serviced, when flushed, water would rise in bowl to bottom lip and never flush completely. Yes, I did inform front desk. Hallway loud due to kids running up, down screaming. This is a non smoking hotel, however, when I opened door there was a smoke smell. I notified front desk who said they would send up someone to check hallway for smoke. Oh well, I won't be staying here again.

Summary Heading: great hotel..but beware to check booking details
Summary: the hotel was, in the end, perfect. 10 min drive to disneyworld or take a free shuttle, parking at disney is so smooth and transfers to the park are easy so no need to take shuttle if u have a car. we had an enormous 2 room suite with fridge microwave and easily enjoyed ourselves with 4 kids. the pool was clean and fun, breakfast great, the hotel spotless, laundry only 1:25. the only issue is that we thought we had booked the anaheim-disney hotel, and i requested the cancellation policy and was told 24 hours. when i called to change the travel dates (still unaware i was bokoed to the wrong hotel) i was told it was cancellation 24 AFTER booking, not up to arrival time. After insisting on talking to the highest ranking supervisor at Marriot bookings, i managed to change the

On a roadtrip, my family started planning a disneyland trip for the beginning of August.  We called Marriot and requested the nearest resort to Disneyland.  The representative told us this was right across the street and proceeded to book us at this resort.  He took our credit card and told us that it would not be charged until be checked in.  When we arrived home a week later and looked over our confirmation, to our dismay, instead of booking us in the Fairfield Inn in Anaheim, he booked us 10 minutes away in Buena Park.  We cancelled the reservation and booked a resort closer to the park.  When we checked our credit card transactions, it reflected a charge for a night stay at this resort.  We called this resort and after several attempts, finally reached a guest experience
Manager Response: This individual reserved a room at the Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott Buena Park under Marriott's Advance Purchase rate. The Advance Purchase rate is a discounted/prepay in-full & non-refundable reservation type. The details of Marriott's Advance Purchase rate are explained in-full on Marriott's official website during and after the reservation process including in the confirmation e-mail that is sent after the reservation is confirmed. Unfortunately, the individual who wrote this review cancelled their reservation before they could stay with us. We have invited this individual to stay with us at a discounted rate in the hopes of showing them the high quality service our property offers in both physical appearance and staff professionalism. This individual has declined our offer several times and to date has never stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Buena Park, CA.

Summary Heading: Great Place Close To Knotts Berry Farm & Disneyland
Summary: The hotel was close to the local attractions but off the freeway so no freeway noise. The is a variety of restaurants close by also. It is easy to get to the hotel from the freeway. The rooms are nicely appointed and very comfortable. The shower & toilet are separate from the sink area. Had a problem with the tv but a call to the front desk and someone was there and fixed it promptly. This hotel is aimed at families and they accomodate them well. The small workout room could have used a fan to circulate the air but other than that it was nice. The breakfast area is large and the food provided was good.

We stayed here for a couple nights in order to visit disneyland and it was a great play to stay.  Nice rooms with a bunch of place.  I have never had a hotel room with two full bathrooms before but it really came in handy.  The bed was comfortable and the separate sitting area was better than expected.  No complaints from us.  They have a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland but we had a car so we just drove.  I think their shuttle leaves for disneyland at two different times in the morning but you have to sign up early because they will fill up fast.

Newly remodelled hotel; both rooms and lobby.  Close to freeway (within 2 to 3 minutes drive) in any 4 directions.  Located behind/block away Knotts Berry Farm and 10 minutes drive to Disneyland.   There is a Subway, Fuddruckers, coffee shop, Korean restaurant next to parking lot.  There is a grocery, Target, Wendy's, and Denny's across the block/cross the traffic light.   Clean rooms with microwave, refrigerator, small flat screen TV.    Very small bathroom with shower/tub.   Very small sink is outside bathroom; hardly any space to lay toiletries.   Poor breakfast layout; area is tight & cramped everyday (due to families and theme park people) especially within 30 minutes before closing; everyone rushes down last minute.  Breakfast time should be extended longer hours.   Free

Summary Heading: I will never stay here again!!!
Summary: There is a dishonest employee who works at this establishment.  They used my credit card continously charging my card for thousands of dollars while I was checked into the hotel.  I didn't find out about this until I returned home a week later.  The hotel manager is denying that this occured at her hotel.  Some one had to have keyed in the numbers of my credit card.  Good thing my bank declined each transaction I just wish the actual charge for the night hadn't gone through either. They are just telling me sorry for the inconveience this has caused you rather than trying to keep a customer. I stayed  here last summer and that was the reason for my return visit this summer.  We were going on a cruise and so this hotel was in a good location to the docks.  If we hadn't have had

What a pleasant stay! We checked in smoothly and quickly. No waiting after a full day or airlines. From check in to check out the entire staff was friendly, courteous, and quick to provide excellent customer service. Our family of 4 (children 5 & 8) stayed in a queen suite (2 full baths, 2 queen beds). There was a living room area with a flat screen TV and a full bath. The bedroom had a flat screen TV, 2 beds a full bath, LARGE counter space with a coffee machine. lots of hooks to hang up towels and bathing suits. VERY CLEAN rooms and housekeeping was meticulous. Morning breakfasts were good.  We ate around 7-7:30a to beat the rush. During busy times it was hard to find seating right away. They had cereal, coffee, bagels, muffins, scrambled eggs and waffles daily. They changed

I was warmly greeted upon check in. Stayed here one night after a long day at Disneyland. It's always nice to have a clean room after a long day. I really don't have anything negative to say about this property it wasn't my first Disneyland choice but being the height of the season I didn't have many options and I'm happy to say that this was a great choice only 6 minutes from the park! It may be my new go to for Disneyland. My only suggestion would be that the breakfast wasn't as good as some other Fairfield Inn's I've stayed at. I wish they would have had fresh oatmeal instead of the instant packets but I'm just being picky now...all in all I would recommend this hotel for a clean and convenient disneyland hotel!

Our family stayed one night in two identical rooms at this hotel that is conveniently located near Knott's Berry Farm and the 91 freeway. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. The bright greens and oranges utilized in the room and lobby decor is cheerful and nicely done. The staff was friendly and helpful.   Our only complaint is the size of the breakfast area.There were many familes and a sports team or two staying there when we did, and at 7:30am there was nowhere to sit. We had to wait for a table and clean it ourselves.  To their credit, the employees in the breakfast area did a great job of constantly refilling the food to feed the hungry crowd,
Satyed here in May of 2012 on a business trip.  Very clean hotel, good parking spacious rooms, good price.  The location was easy to find and had good access.  We would definatly stay here agan.

We bring a large group of middle schoolers here every year while we go to Disneyland and Knott's.  They are always very accomodating and provide a great breakfast and great service.  Highly recommended!

After reading all the reviews good and bad didn't know if I should book here. I'm used to staying at marriotts that have a kitchen but since it has complimentary breakfast and free parking as well as a shuttle for free to disneyland and knotts i said i will give it a chance. i will be staying this thursday for one night just to try it out. I'll let you know how my stay goes.

We stayed at this hotel for six nights and it was clean and comfortable. We had a two room suite with two bathrooms, and as a mom of a teenage girl, this was perfect. The two beds were both in the same room, which is odd, and the couch was not a fold out. But we managed around that issue (movable mattress). The room was exceptionally clean, as were the bathrooms and the hotel lobby. It was quiet except for a few guests but we had the fan on anyway so they were not heard. The breakfast was different every day we ate there and it was good and there was a wide variety of items. The staff was nice and pleasant during our stay. We were only 10 minutes from Disneyland so it was very convenient if you don't want to stay right at the park. We would definitely stay there again!

I had read pretty good reviews about this place. However, it was the worst experience I have ever had in a hotel. The people across the way partied loudly all night long. I knocked twice and asked the noisy party to quiet down. I called the Front Desk 3 times. Finally, at 5:15 am (I had to get up at 6:00) a Manager finally shut them up. I figured I would be met with very contrite and apologetic staff the next morning. But I got the absolute opposite reaction. The "Night Manager" was incredibly rude, inappropriate, and insulting. So, after a night of not sleeping and awful treatment from

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable but very very busy and somewhat loud
Summary: Quality of the room was exactly what you expect from a Fairfield Inn and a Marriott brand hotel.  The room was clean and comfortable.  My reservation was made via the Marriott web site and I requested extra pillows and they were there when I checked in.   The hotel is newly renovated and used to be a Hampton Inn so the furnishings are new.    The hotel was very busy. I checked in at 11:00 PM on a Friday night and there were more people needing assistance than the haggared looking front desk person could handle.  Despite that he was polite and efficient and effective with each guest.   It is a hotel that services a tourist crowd so be prepared for kids and teens in the halls at hours that you may want to sleep.

Summary Heading: hard beds equal to bad service
Summary: we just checked in tonight and I wanted to review while fresh in my mind. The man at the front desk was very cold . I was told at check in my kids were an extra $10.00 each , I was never told that at time of reservation and with a prepaid reservation , what choice did I have. I have never been charged extra for a child. The beds are hard as a rock, we did not get our extra pillows or towels requested either. I am very disapointed.
Here on business. Clean, located walking distance from most every need. Totally impressed with the value.
very clean, nice and spacious rooms. pleasant staff.

We stayed at this multi-story hotel Jan 2012.  It is in a convenient location near Knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland, and just off the freeway.  The hotel is clean and managed well and our room (223) was clean, well lit and equipped.  Although the freeway is a short distance away, there was no noise from it.  The only reason I give this hotel a 4 rating instead of 5 is that there was two school sports teams booked into the hotel at the same time we were there.  There was considerable noise in the halls late (we were with 6 year old children).  And in the morning at breakfast time, there were roughly 50 teenagers in the breakfast area eating.  They were lined up against the walls, sitting in the hall, in the lounge area, in the front desk area, etc.  We could not even reach the

Summary Heading: Always a good experience at Fairfield Inn
Summary: I stayed here after a recent visit to Knott's Berry Farm. The hotel was a mile away from the theme park, which was extremely convenient. My room was extremely spacious and clean, and my bed was super comfy. The parking was free as well, which is always nice to have. No complaints whatsoever, I really enjoyed my stay!

We used our Marriott points and get upgraded to the king suite.   Room: There are 2 full bathrooms, 2 TVs, a larger-than-dorm-size mini fridge, microwave, and even enough room for 2 kids to run around.  Room is clean with bright color furniture, bathrooms are a bit small but we're only staying for 3 days so it didn't bother us.  An extra rollaway bed is $10 per night. Our room is very close to the elevator and we can hear a lot of people walking and talking on the hallway.  Location: The hotel is not too far away from highway 5. It's less than 10 mins from Disney and less than 5 mins from Knott Berry Farm. There's a Target on the other side of Beach Blvd. You can also find fast food places (e.g. Subway) around.  ** Free round trip shuttle to the Disney and Knott Berry Farm that

Summary Heading: I liked it much better when it was a Hampton Inn
Summary: I have stayed here many times before when it was a Hampton Inn and I liked it better then.  Sure the rooms are refurbished and spruced up a little now, but the direct lies told by the front desk clerks can't overcome that.  Room looks nice and new, but small.  Bathroom is virtually unusable.  Sink is tucked into a walled in area (see picture), no sink space to lay things and shower/toilet room door opens right into anyone at the sink.  Shower/toilet room is a dank dark cave, spend a few bucks and put a higher wattage light in there.  Breakfast was unappealing and too many screaming running uncontrolled kids there.  Parents did nothing to try to control them.  Now the direct lie by the front desk night person.  There were NO vending machines on the floors, they force you to come

Summary Heading: Best hotel that I Ever stayed at!
Summary: This place is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at. Brand new funiture and Flat screes and free Breakfast!

Wow....... what a difference since they changed brands....this hotel is clean and beautiful. staff is so friendly and helpful...nice to have a fresh new room and new bed....  Buena Park was in need of this great addition......

Good location from Disneyland. Only about a 7 minute drive. The staff is great, very polite and attentive. Rooms however are a bit on the small side. Bathroom was extremely small. Elevators were broken and we got stuck for several minutes each time we used them. Breakfast was disappointing as I always look forward to making waffles when I stay at the Marriott Hotels but, this time around no waffles or no fresh fruit. The eggs and other items did not look appetizing, at least they had juice, yogurt and cereal for your little ones. Overall hotel was alright but I'll probably stay somewhere else next time.

We had a wonderful experience at this hotel.  All the staff we encountered was very friendly and attentive.  Hotel is very clean and remodeled.  There was a mini refrigerator and a microwave in the room.  Complimentary breakfast consisted of make your own waffles, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches (egg & cheese), cereals, yogurts, breads, muffins, bagels, juices, milk and coffee. Well worth your stay!

I don't normally stay in this grade hotel.  I was pleasantly surprised.  We stayed here to go to Knotts Berry Farm the next day so that we would not have to drive far first and would wake up fresh in the morning for a long fun day at the park.  The hotel room was very clean and up to date.  They served a WONDERFUL complimentary breakfast the next morning.  It was on the same level that we have paid for before at Westins and the like.  I would definitely stay here again for our next trip to Knotts.  Great for familys and business travelers!
